0.title: India's 'first-of-its-kind' brain health clinic inaugurated in B'luru
0.article_body: A brain health clinic, said to be the first-of-its-kind in India, was inaugurated on Friday at Bengaluru's Jayanagar General Hospital by Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar. The minister said the clinic has been established by the Karnataka Health Department in association with NIMHANS institute. He said such clinics will also be inaugurated in Kolar and Chikkaballapura districts of Karnataka.

1.title: Head Constable arrested in Ludhiana, 1.8 kg poppy husk seized
1.article_body: Ludhiana Police on Friday said they have arrested a Police Head Constable, Anil Kumar, for allegedly being involved in drug peddling and seized 1.8 kg of poppy husk from him. Police said Kumar was deputed as the gunman for BJP Kisan Morcha National Secretary, Sukhminderpal Singh Grewal. Kumar was arrested during a special checking drive, the investigating officer said.

2.title: Taapsee-starrer 'Dobaaraa' to open Indian Film Festival of Melbourne
2.article_body: The upcoming thriller 'Dobaaraa' which features Taapsee Pannu and Pavail Gulati will be opening the 2022 Indian Film Festival of Melbourne. The Anurag Kashyap directorial premiered at the London Film Festival on June 23. 'Dobaaraa' is a remake of the 2018 Spanish film 'Mirage' which shows a mother who interacts with the ghost of a child to save his life.

3.title: Russia's military taking hundreds of casualties daily in Ukraine: US
3.article_body: Russia's military is taking hundreds of casualties a day in its war in Ukraine, a senior US defence official said on Friday. The death toll includes thousands of lieutenants and captains, the official added. Notably, Russia classifies military deaths as state secrets even in times of peace and has not updated its official casualty figures frequently during the war.

4.title: I'm a very cool captain: Dhawan on his captaincy style before 1st ODI vs WI
4.article_body: Talking about his captaincy style after the toss in first India-West Indies ODI, Shikhar Dhawan said he's a "very cool captain" and makes sure that the team's energy stays up. "And of course I love to take all...right decisions and keep the process going," he added. Dhawan is leading Team India for the three-match ODI series against West Indies.

5.title: Over 2,700 convicted for crimes against women, children in 3 months: UP govt
5.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government on Friday said 2,756 people accused of rape and other crimes against women and children were punished in three months. UP Additional Chief Secretary Awanish Kumar Awasthi stated from March 25 to July 16, 2022, 328 people were given life imprisonment, 594 people were sentenced for over 10 years and 1,834 for less than 10 years.

6.title: I want to watch 'Sholay' in Tamil, 'Nayakan' in Hindi: Madhavan
6.article_body: Speaking at an event, actor R Madhavan said that he wants to watch the 1975 Hindi film 'Sholay' in Tamil and the 1987 Tamil film 'Nayakan' in Hindi. "Sometimes you don't get to enjoy the performances because you are busy reading subtitles," the actor said. 'Sholay' features Amitabh Bachchan, Dharmendra, Amjad Khan and Sanjeev Kumar. 'Nayakan' features Kamal Haasan.

7.title: There's a need to standardise disaster management system: K'taka CM
7.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday said that there is a need to standardise the disaster management system to reduce the impact of disasters on human lives. "For the last 10 years, the state has seen floods almost every alternate year," Bommai said. "It's not possible to prevent natural disasters, but we need...effective measures before and after disasters," Bommai said.

8.title: 4 out of 5 UNSC members support India's bid for permanent seat: Govt
8.article_body: Four out of five permanent members of the UN Security Council (UNSC) support India's candidature for a permanent seat in the top world body, the government informed the Lok Sabha. Various initiatives aimed at building international support for India are being undertaken, it said. "The matter is consistently taken up during bilateral and multilateral meetings at all levels," it added.

9.title: Goa restaurant run by Smriti Irani's daughter gets notice over alleged illegal bar licence
9.article_body: A restaurant operated by Union Minister Smriti Irani's daughter, Zoish, got a notice from the Goa Excise Commissioner for allegedly holding an illegal bar license. The show cause notice said, "The licence was renewed last month, despite the licence holder having passed away on 17/05/2021." The matter is set to be heard in court on July 29.

10.title: Truck overturns on auto after collision in Haryana; 7 killed, 4 injured
10.article_body: At least seven people were killed and four others sustained injuries after a speeding truck overturned on an auto-rickshaw after colliding with it in Haryana's Mewat district on Friday, police said. The injured persons have been admitted to a hospital for treatment, according to a police inspector. The highway was reportedly cleared with the help of a crane.

11.title: Ajinkya Rahane and wife Radhika expecting their 2nd child, share pic
11.article_body: Cricketer Ajinkya Rahane and his wife Radhika Rahane took to Instagram to announce that they are expecting their second child together. Sharing a picture, Radhika wrote, "October 2022." Ajinkya and Radhika were blessed with their first child, daughter Aarya, in October 2019. Ajinkya and Radhika got married in 2014.

12.title: I am rubber, Twitter is glue: Musk after Twitter partially blames him for drop in revenue
12.article_body: After Twitter partially blamed Elon Musk for its drop in revenue, the Tesla CEO tweeted, "I am rubber, Twitter is glue." Twitter's revenue fell year-on-year to $1.18 billion from $1.19 billion. The microblogging firm blamed the drop in revenue on "advertising weakness" and uncertainty related to its pending $44-billion acquisition by Elon Musk.

13.title: 32-year-old man from Andhra Pradesh found dead at Isha Yoga Centre in Tamil Nadu
13.article_body: A 32-year-old man from Andhra Pradesh was found dead in his room at Isha Yoga Centre near Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore. As per Coimbatore District (Rural) Police Superintendent, V Badrinarayanan, the man, identified as Gullu Ramana, had come to the centre on July 15 to attend a six-month programme. "The cause of the death...would be known after the post-mortem," Badrinarayanan added.

14.title: Ricky Martin's husband shares pic with him after nephew withdraws sexual harassment claim
14.article_body: A judge on Thursday decided to not extend a temporary restraining order placed against singer Ricky Martin this month by his nephew after the relative dropped the sexual harassment case. Hours after the court ruling, Martin said that he was a "victim of lies". Martin's husband, Jwan Yosef, shared a picture with him on Instagram and wrote, "Truth prevails."

15.title: Maha CM lifts restrictions on festivals imposed due to COVID-19
15.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde has lifted restrictions on festivals which were in force since March 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Now, there will be no curbs on Ganesh Chaturthi, Dahi Handi, Muharram processions, among other religious events. The earlier restrictions included ban on processions and curbs on the height of Lord Ganesh idols.

16.title: Devotee donates gold crown worth ₹33 lakh to Shirdi Saibaba Temple
16.article_body: An 80-year-old doctor from Hyderabad donated a gold crown worth ₹33 lakh to Saibaba Temple in Maharashtra's Shirdi on Friday, Shri Saibaba Sansthan Trust CEO Bhagyashree Banayat said. The crown which is studded with diamonds weighs 707 gms in total, she added. Dr Manda Ramkrishna said that he had fulfilled his promise to donate a gold crown to the shrine.

17.title: Forest dept looking for agents selling 'protected' land in Mumbai
17.article_body: Forest department officials are on the hunt for agents who are allegedly selling land and building houses at Sanjay Gandhi National Park in Mumbai which is a Protected Area. A man was detained in connection to the racket on Thursday from Kandivali East. Forest personnel are also being looked at for alleged support to the racket, officials said.

18.title: Over the moon, congratulations brother: Akshay on Suriya's National Award
18.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar took to Twitter to congratulate actor Suriya for winning the National Award for Best Actor along with Ajay Devgn for his film 'Soorarai Pottru'. Akshay wrote, "Over the moon to see #SooraraiPottru win the top honours at the National Awards. Heartfelt congratulations my brother...Humbled to be working in the Hindi adaptation of such an iconic film."

19.title: Good luck: Ashwin on Gill's return to ODIs after 18 months in Port of Spain
19.article_body: Reacting to India opener Shubman Gill's return to ODI cricket after 18 months, Ravichandran Ashwin tweeted, "Good luck Gill and team." The 22-year-old is playing in the first ODI against West Indies in Port of Spain today. He scored his maiden half-century in the format in 36 balls. Gill last played in an ODI in December 2020.

20.title: ED seizes ₹20 crore-cash after raids on Bengal minister Partha's aide, others
20.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Friday said it has seized cash worth ₹20 crore after raiding various premises, including the house of Arpita Mukherjee, an associate of West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee. The raids were conducted in connection with an alleged teacher recruitment scam. The amount is suspected to be proceeds of crime of the said SSC scam, ED stated.

21.title: Vijay Deverakonda wears slippers worth ₹199 at 'Liger' trailer launch
21.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda, who will make his Bollywood debut with 'Liger', wore slippers worth ₹199 at the trailer launch of the film. His stylist Harmann Kaur revealed that the actor wanted to "keep a very underdog look" to "be closest to the character". "I was constantly nervous...and walking in wearing chappals worth ₹199 was really brave of Vijay," Harmann said.

22.title: Reliance Industries' profit jumps 46% to ₹17,955 crore, revenue up 54% in Q1
22.article_body: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries Limited's (RIL) consolidated net profit jumped 46.3% to ₹17,955 crore in the April-June quarter from ₹12,273 crore a year ago. Meanwhile, RIL's revenue from operations came in at ₹2,23,113 crore from ₹1,44,372 crore, an increase of 54.5% year-on-year. Further, Reliance Jio reported 23.8% rise in standalone net profit at ₹4,335 crore in Q1.

23.title: 15-16 Cong MLAs voted for Murmu in Presidential poll: Assam CM
23.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Friday claimed that 15-16 Congress MLAs from the state voted for NDA's nominee Droupadi Murmu in the Presidential election. Assam Congress President Bhupen Bora also admitted that there was cross-voting in the Presidential poll. The Congress has 27 MLAs in Assam Legislative Assembly, but three of them have been suspended due to anti-party activities.

24.title: MPs walk out of Parliamentary panel meet, say Agnipath discussion denied
24.article_body: BSP MP Danish Ali and Congress MPs KC Venugopal and Uttam Kumar Reddy, who are part of Parliamentary Standing Committee on Defence, walked out of the committee's meeting on Friday. Venugopal said they had walked out in protest after committee Chairman Jual Oram refused to hold a discussion on the "controversial" Agnipath scheme despite their repeated requests.

25.title: I'm elated to win Best Actor: Ajay Devgn on National Award for 'Tanhaji'
25.article_body: Ajay Devgn, who received the Best Actor Award at the National Awards along with Suriya, said that he is elated to win for 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior'. "I thank everyone, most of all my creative team, the audience and my fans," he added. This is Ajay's third National Award for Best Actor after 'Zakhm' and 'The Legend of Bhagat Singh'.

26.title: India equal Sri Lanka's world record for having most captains in a calendar year
26.article_body: India on Friday equalled Sri Lanka's world record for having most captains in a calendar year. After taking the field in the first ODI against West Indies, Shikhar Dhawan became the seventh captain to lead India in international cricket in 2022. Sri Lanka used seven captains in 2017. No team has had more than seven captains in a calendar year.

27.title: Ex-world no. 3 Thiem reaches 1st Tour-level semis in 14 months in Gstaad
27.article_body: Ex-world number three Dominic Thiem reached his first ATP Tour semi-final since May 2021 after defeating Peruvian qualifier Juan Pablo Varillas 6-4, 6-3 at EFG Swiss Open Gstaad on Friday. The Austrian, who is currently ranked 274, missed the second half of the last season due to wrist injury. Thiem will face second seed Matteo Berrettini in the semi-final.

28.title: Bhuvan Bam injured while shooting for 'Taaza Khabar', calls it freak accident
28.article_body: YouTuber Bhuvan Bam recently injured himself while shooting an action sequence for his upcoming web show 'Taaza Khabar'. He reportedly injured his left arm and shoulder but resumed shooting after a break. "It was a freak accident during the action scenes. Thankfully it wasn't serious. We could thankfully resume the shoot almost immediately after a small break," the YouTuber said.

29.title: Pimpri-Chinchwad police to act against men loitering near schools
29.article_body: Commissioner of Police, Pimpri-Chinchwad, Ankush Shinde has ordered all officials in-charge of police stations to take action against men found loitering near schools and colleges. Officials released helpline numbers 112 and 020-27352500 to share information on persons misbehaving with women and girl students. The move comes as in-classroom studies have begun in the state.

30.title: Indian pair of Tanisha-Ishaan loses in quarters at Taipei Open
30.article_body: India's mixed doubles pair of Ishaan Bhatnagar and Tanisha Crasto crashed out of the Taipei Open after losing in the quarter-final on Friday. The sixth seeds lost to unseeded Malaysians Hoo Pang Ron and Toh Ee Wei 19-21, 12-21 in 32 minutes. Tanisha also lost in women's doubles quarter-final. Meanwhile, third seed Parupalli Kashyap lost in men's singles quarter-final.

31.title: Uncertainty on members per ward in Pimpri-Chinchwad civic polls
31.article_body: The final voters' list for the Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation polls has been released but uncertainty prevails on whether the elections will be held on a three-member ward system. The previous Maha Vikas Aghadi government had changed the system to a three-member ward system. Civic officials said the proposal to revert to the old four-member system is before the new Cabinet.

32.title: Follow your inner calling: PM to those who cleared CBSE Class 12 exams
32.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday congratulated students who cleared the CBSE Class 12 exams. "They prepared for these exams through a time when humanity faced a monumental challenge and achieved this success," he said. The PM urged them to follow their inner calling and pursue subjects they are passionate about.

33.title: Indian wrestling team is the best: WFI President ahead of CWG 2022
33.article_body: Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) President Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh has said the country's team is the best in the upcoming Commonwealth Games 2022. "However, you can't say we will win all (12) the gold medals because someday, luck also plays a part," he added. CWG will begin on July 28 in Birmingham. Wrestling events to start on August 5.

34.title: 2 criminals wanted in cases including murder arrested in Haryana
34.article_body: Two criminals wanted in multiple cases have been arrested in separate incidents in Haryana, police said. Lokesh alias Gogi was arrested in Rohtak. Police said he was wanted in eight cases including that of murder, attempt to murder and kidnapping. The second criminal, Bijender alias Punji, was wanted in nearly a dozen cases including that of murder, police added.

35.title: ₹100-200 crore club puts pressure on experimenting with subjects: Vaani
35.article_body: Actress Vaani Kapoor has stated in an interview that the concept of the ₹100-200 crore club has put a lot of pressure on filmmakers to continue creating art. "People get scared of experimenting with subjects," she added. The actress further said that it gets harder to mount films on people who are not already at the top of their game.

36.title: Putin is healthy: CIA chief on rumours about Russian Prez's health
36.article_body: Speaking at a security forum, CIA chief Bill Burns said, "There are lots of rumours about President [Vladimir] Putin's health and as far as we can tell, he's entirely too healthy." However, Burns clarified that his remark didn't constitute "a formal intelligence judgment". Notably, Russia has accused Ukraine, the UK and the US of spreading fake information about Putin's health.

37.title: Shoppers Stop announces Weekend Special Offer
37.article_body: Inspired by the fantastic response received on their ongoing sale, Shoppers Stop has decided to go bigger by giving irresistible deals and discounts this weekend, the brand revealed. Customers can avail ‘Buy 1 Get 1’ offer on brands across men's, women's and kids' wear categories. The brand also announced 'Buy 2 at 50% off' offer from July 22 to 24.

38.title: ED seizes jewels, bank deposits worth ₹253 crore of Nirav Modi's firms in Hong Kong
38.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has attached gems, jewellery and bank deposits worth ₹253.62 crore of companies linked to fugitive diamond merchant Nirav Modi in Hong Kong as part of a money laundering probe. With this, the total attached and seized assets tally in the case stands at ₹2,650.07 crore, the ED said. Nirav is presently lodged in a UK jail.

39.title: Amazing to be noticed in debut 'Samrat...': Manushi on signing 'Tehran'
39.article_body: Speaking about signing her third film 'Tehran', actress Manushi Chhillar said that it is amazing to have been noticed for her work in debut film 'Samrat Prithviraj'. The film, which features John Abraham, is based on true events. "I...love this genre of films that are inspired by true events and I hope to do my best in 'Tehran'," she added.

40.title: It's our fortune a tribal woman will grace Prez's post: Arjun Munda
40.article_body: Union Tribal Affairs Minister Arjun Munda on Friday said that it is our fortune that a tribal woman will grace the post of the country's President. "Years after independence, India and its tribal community are growing with new opportunities," he said. His comment comes after Droupadi Murmu was elected as the 15th President of India.

41.title: Jewellery store burgled, valuables worth ₹41 lakh stolen in Thane
41.article_body: Police on Friday said that unidentified persons broke into a jewellery store and stole valuables worth ₹41 lakh in Thane. The accused damaged a wall of a tyre shop next to it and entered the store in Vartak Nagar, police added. The accused stole 652 grams of gold and 40 kg of silver worth ₹41 lakh, police said.

42.title: Cong-JD(S) coalition govt an outcome of 'selfish politics': K'taka CM
42.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Thursday said that the Congress-JD(S) coalition government in the state was the outcome of 'selfish politics'. "We have seen the worst kind of selfish politics in 2018-19 when alliances were formed with everyone, law and order was compromised to retain power," Bommai said. "That is the politics of attaining and retaining power," he added.

43.title: Not the time for ego: Oppn VP candidate on TMC's decision to skip polls
43.article_body: Opposition's Vice President candidate Margaret Alva on Friday called TMC's decision to abstain from voting in Vice Presidential elections "disappointing". "This isn't the time for 'whataboutery', ego or anger," she said. "This is the time for courage, leadership and unity. I believe Mamata Banerjee, who is the epitome of courage, will stand with the Opposition," Alva added.

44.title: Upcoming Pune-B'luru corridor to reduce distance between the cities by 95 km
44.article_body: The upcoming Pune-Bengaluru Greenfield corridor is going to reduce the distance between the two cities by 95 km and travel time by around four to five hours, as per reports. The current distance between the cities is 840 km, which will be reduced to 745 km with the new corridor. The project is in the proposal stage.

45.title: Bihar man kills mother, said her witchcraft killed his wife: Report
45.article_body: A man named Badri Manjhi murdered his mother with an axe and seriously injured his father in Bihar's Naubatpur area on Thursday. This came after Badri's wife developed a severe stomach ache and later died in a hospital. According to a report, Badri attacked his parents after claiming that his wife had died due to 'tantra-mantra' (witchcraft) used by them.

46.title: Have been hearing it for 10 years now, it doesn't matter to me: Dhawan on criticism
46.article_body: On being asked about facing criticism almost every time after failing to score big in a couple of matches, Shikhar Dhawan said, "I don't feel strange. I have been hearing it for 10 years now." "They keep saying, I keep playing. It doesn't matter to me. If it did, I wouldn't have been here today," Dhawan added.

47.title: India announce their playing XI for 1st ODI against West Indies
47.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in the first ODI. Captain Shikhar Dhawan and Shubman Gill will open the batting for India, while Shreyas Iyer has been named vice-captain. India's playing XI also includes Sanju Samson, Deepak Hooda, Axar Patel and Prasidh Krishna.

48.title: WI looking forward to India series to correct some rights, wrongs: Pooran
48.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran said his side is looking forward to correcting some rights and wrongs in ODI series against India. West Indies were whitewashed 3-0 against Bangladesh at home. "We're just looking forward to some things going our way because the guys have been putting in a lot of work," he added. First ODI will be played today.

49.title: Salman Khan seeks weapon licence over death threat letter: Report
49.article_body: Actor Salman Khan has submitted an application to Mumbai Police seeking a weapon licence for personal protection, as per reports. This comes after Salman and his father Salim Khan received a death threat letter last month. A video showed Salman leaving the office of Mumbai Police Commissioner Vivek Phansalkar on Friday.

50.title: Jail guard injured after car knocks him down at checkpoint in Gurugram
50.article_body: Gurugram Police on Thursday said that a jail guard, Sanjay Kumar, was injured after being knocked down by a private car at an entry checkpoint of Bhondsi jail. The driver of the car also threatened to kill Kumar before fleeing the scene. "We have identified the car and are conducting raids to nab the driver," an official said.

51.title: SC allows govt to continue with security cover for Mukesh Ambani, family
51.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday allowed the Centre to continue providing security cover for Reliance Industries' Mukesh Ambani and his family in Mumbai. A vacation bench on June 29 had stayed the orders of Tripura HC on a PIL challenging the grant of security cover to the family. The SC said there was no justification for it to be heard.

52.title: Only SC can examine disputes arising from Prez polls: Delhi HC
52.article_body: All disputes arising from the Presidential or Vice Presidential election can only be examined and decided upon by the Supreme Court, said the Delhi High Court. The court was responding to a petition which sought to prevent lawmakers imprisoned in criminal cases from casting their vote. The plea is not maintainable according to the Constitution, the court said.

53.title: Thought Nadal was going to play until young, he's playing until old: Gonzalez
53.article_body: Former world number five Fernando Gonzalez has said he thought 22-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal was going to play until young and he is playing until old. "It stopped surprising me," he added. The 36-year-old has won 35 out of 38 matches this season so far. He won four titles, including Grand Slams in Australia and France.

54.title: Man with smuggled gold worth ₹1.21 cr arrested at Varanasi airport
54.article_body: Customs officials seized over two-kg gold of foreign origin from a passenger at Varanasi airport on Friday. The man had come to Varanasi from the UAE in an Air India Express flight. "[The smuggled] gold was kept in the form of 20 gold bars, concealed in black tape and wrapped under waist," an official said. The accused has been arrested.

55.title: 'Forrest Gump' can't be translated, 'Laal...' is very desi: Atul Kulkarni
55.article_body: Actor Atul Kulkarni, who will make his film writing debut with Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha', said that the original 1994 film 'Forrest Gump' cannot be translated and only adapted. "Everything is Indianised in 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. It's a very desi film made for Indian audiences," he added. Atul and Aamir earlier worked together in 2006 film 'Rang De Basanti'.

56.title: I'm an entirely new person: Naga Chaitanya on divorce with Samantha
56.article_body: Speaking about his divorce with Samantha Ruth Prabhu, Naga Chaitanya said that he is "an entirely new person". He said that he has changed a lot, adding he couldn't open up much earlier but is able to now. "Feeling very much attached to my family...and friends," he added. The two got married in 2017 and announced their separation in 2021.

57.title: Video shows Ajoy asking to be 'detained' after Cong protests, he replies
57.article_body: A video of Congress leader Ajoy Kumar asking to be taken inside the police bus which was carrying detained Congress leaders after Thursday's protests has gone viral. The video showed Kumar saying, "You need to take me yaar...Humko bhi ghusne do." He later tweeted, "The bus was full...Had it been a demonstration of the RSS-BJP, the bus would've remained empty."

58.title: Who won what at the National Film Awards announced today?
58.article_body: 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' won Best Popular Film Providing Wholesome Entertainment at the 68th National Film Awards announced on Friday. Biju Menon won Best Supporting Actor for Malayalam film 'AK Ayyappanum Koshiyum'. Lakshmipriyaa Chandramouli won Best Supporting Actress for 'Sivaranjiniyum Innum Sila Pengalum' (Tamil). Sachidanandan KR won Best Direction award for 'AK Ayyappanum Koshiyum'.

59.title: How much money does Virat Kohli earn from each sponsored post on Instagram?
59.article_body: As per the HopperHQ's Instagram Rich List 2022, former India captain Virat Kohli earns $1,088,000 (₹8.69 crore) per sponsored post on Instagram. Kohli is currently placed 14th on the HopperHQ's Instagram Rich List 2022. He is the only Asian among the top 25 on the list. Cristiano Ronaldo is on top of the list, earning $2,397,000 per sponsored Instagram post.

60.title: Govt shares state-wise list of MBBS seats in the country
60.article_body: The Centre informed the Lok Sabha that there are 612 medical colleges in the country with MBBS seats. Tamil Nadu has the highest number of seats (10,725), followed by Karnataka (10,145). Maharashtra has 9,895 MBBS seats, while Uttar Pradesh has 9,053 seats. Out of the total 91,927 seats in the country, 48,012 are government seats, while 43,915 are private seats.

61.title: Shardul is not a good all-rounder like teammate Hardik: Styris
61.article_body: On being asked if India all-rounder Shardul Thakur should play all three ODIs against West Indies, Scott Styris said that Shardul isn't as good an all-rounder as teammate Hardik Pandya. He added that Shardul is fighting for a backup spot rather than one of the players to play as a frontline. Hardik has been rested for the India-West Indies series.

62.title: Wished Murmu on behalf of the people of Odisha: Naveen Patnaik
62.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Friday said he spoke to newly-elected President Droupadi Murmu and wished her all the very best on behalf of the people of Odisha. "Entire family of 4.5 crore people of Odisha are proud of her achievement," Patnaik tweeted. President-elect Droupadi Murmu was born in a tribal family in Odisha.

63.title: Hyderabad couple dies by suicide by consuming poison, bodies found
63.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Thursday found the bodies of two people, who allegedly died by suicide after consuming poison, and the police suspect that the deceased were in a relationship. Their bodies were discovered in an open space by locals. Police said the man was identified as 25-year-old Satish, a resident of Nalgonda, and the woman's age was ascertained at 23.

64.title: Temple desecrated in Bihar's Kishanganj; 1 arrested
64.article_body: A temple was desecrated in Bihar's Kishanganj district by some "anti-social elements" on Friday, an official said. The devotees found the idol at the Kali temple vandalised which led to the Bajrang Dal, among others, staging a demonstration, the SDM said. He added that the situation is now under control and one of the suspects has been arrested.

65.title: Ajay Devgn, Suriya get Best Actor National Award; Aparna Balamurali named Best Actress
65.article_body: The government today announced the 68th National Film Awards. The award for the Best Actor was won jointly by Ajay Devgn for Hindi film 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' and Suriya for Tamil film 'Soorarai Pottru'. Meanwhile, Aparna Balamurali was named the Best Actress for 'Soorarai Pottru'. The Tamil movie also won the award for Best Feature Film.

66.title: Have gone through mental health issues as a youngster: Robin Uthappa
66.article_body: India cricketer Robin Uthappa revealed that he has gone through "mental health issues" during his younger days. Speaking at an event to mark World Brain Day in Bengaluru, Uthappa said, "I will, in my capacity, do everything to...tell [common man] about the importance of mental health." Notably, Uthappa is the brand ambassador of the Karnataka Brain Health Initiative.

67.title: Traffic curbs issued in Hyderabad in view of Bonalu procession
67.article_body: Hyderabad City Police has issued traffic restrictions in view of Ujjaini Mahankali Bonalu procession on July 25 in the city. Diversions will be enforced from 12 pm to 11 pm on Monday. The Hyderabad Traffic Police requested citizens to avoid the roads that lead to Aliyabad, Lal Darwaza Temple and Mohammed Shukoor Mosque and announced alternate routes for the same.

68.title: Japan identifies China, Russia & N Korea as main security concerns
68.article_body: Japan has identified China, Russia and North Korea as its main security concerns in a defence white paper. It has warned Russia's use of force to resolve a dispute established a precedent that threatens the security of Taiwan, which China claims as its territory. Japan called Russia's invasion of Ukraine a "serious violation of international law".

69.title: I'm living proof of the fact that nepotism never matters: Kashmera Shah
69.article_body: Actress Kashmera Shah, while speaking about nepotism, said, "If someone speaks about nepotism in Bollywood, I take it very personally because I'm living proof of the fact that nepotism never matters." "I was good and hence I got work, thereby helping me shine in this industry. Hence, I don't like people talking against it," Kashmera added.

70.title: Kerala's child rights body directs state to make all schools co-ed
70.article_body: The Kerala Child Rights Commission has directed the education department to convert all schools in the state into co-ed. "We issued an order...[after] we received a complaint in this regard. The aim is to protect our constitutional right to equality," said Manoj Kumar, Chairman of the Child Rights Commission. He added that gender equality should begin at the school level.

71.title: BMC shuts down Mumbai's first digital valet parking due to heavy rains
71.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has shut down Mumbai's first digital valet parking in Dadar due to heavy rainfall this month. The Dadar Vyapari Sangh (DVS) has expressed displeasure over the closure, saying it will create traffic congestion in the area. "We have plans to start the facility again from August 15," BMC Assistant Municipal Commissioner said.

72.title: Woman sets 22-yr-old pregnant daughter-in-law ablaze in T'gana; arrested
72.article_body: A woman in Telangana's Kamareddy was arrested for reportedly pouring petrol on her 22-year-old pregnant daughter-in-law and setting her ablaze. According to police, the woman suffered over 50% burns, lost her four-month-old twins she was carrying and is currently battling for life. Her family alleged she was constantly harassed by in-laws after her love marriage with her husband in 2021.

73.title: 23-yr-old tailor held for killing man over financial dispute in Mumbai
73.article_body: A 23-year-old tailor, Bittukumar Sadhu Sah, was arrested by the Mumbai Crime Branch for allegedly killing a man over a financial dispute in the early hours of Monday. The deceased, 35-year-old Vikas Maheskar, was found dead in Byculla area, police said. Police examined CCTV footage and arrested Bittukumar, who said he killed Maheskar during an altercation over money.

74.title: Capitol rioter who said she wanted to kill US House Speaker jailed
74.article_body: A Capitol rioter who said she wanted to kill US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi during the insurrection has been jailed for 60 days. Dawn Bancroft had filmed a selfie video after storming the US Capitol alongside hundreds of rioters on January 6, 2021, saying that they were looking for the Speaker "to shoot her in the frickin' brain".

75.title: 282 killed, over 200 injured in Pakistan amid heavy rains
75.article_body: At least 282 people have been killed and over 200 people have been injured in Pakistan since June 14 amid heavy rains, the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) said. Among those killed, 160 were women and children, it added. Over 5,500 homes, several bridges and shops have been partially or fully damaged in rains across the country, NDMA further said.

76.title: Still haven't recovered from that loss: Gaurav Chopraa on parents' death
76.article_body: Actor Gaurav Chopraa has said the first wave of COVID-19 was extremely tragic for him as he lost both his parents within a span of ten days. He said that he still hasn't recovered from that loss, adding that his parents were "emotionally, intellectually and psychologically a huge force" in his life. "They suddenly went away...it was tormenting," said Gaurav.

77.title: Mom was worried about me shooting with Tyson, did lots of pujas: Deverakonda
77.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda has revealed that his mother was worried about him shooting with former American boxer Mike Tyson for the upcoming movie 'Liger'. "She did lots of pujas and put vibhuti (sacred ash) and kumkum (turmeric powder) on me before I left for the USA. I'm fine now and her pujas did really work," he added.

78.title: Don't know if I would be the ideal person to train a player: Nadal
78.article_body: Rafael Nadal said he isn't sure if he'd be the "ideal" person to train a tennis player. "I don't contemplate it, although, as the saying goes, never say I won't drink this water," added Nadal. Nadal had recently jokingly stated that he is "too expensive" following a query by Bulgarian tennis player Grigor Dimitrov, over becoming his coach after retirement.

79.title: Why is relief to elderly a 'burden' when MPs get train fare subsidy: Varun
79.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi on Friday criticised the Centre's decision to remove the concession given to senior citizens in train tickets, calling it "unfortunate". He questioned why the relief to the elderly is considered a "burden" when MPs continue to get subsidy on train fare. Earlier, the Railways Minister had told Parliament that granting concessions "weighs heavily" on the Railways.

80.title: Airlines can't deny boarding to disabled travellers without doctor's opinion: DGCA
80.article_body: Amending its regulations, the DGCA stated airlines cannot refuse boarding to any passenger on the basis of their disability. It added that if an airline is apprehensive about a disabled passenger’s health, it must consult a doctor regarding their boarding and if it denies boarding to them, it will have to inform the person and provide its reason in writing.

81.title: BJP will bring stars for friends but will make public yearn for pennies: Rahul
81.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has criticised BJP for allegedly not giving senior citizens concession on railway tickets. "Government spent ₹911 crore on advertisements...₹1,45,000 crore/year on giving tax benefits to its industrialist friends. But can't spend ₹1,500 crore on rail concession," Rahul said. "[BJP] will even bring stars for friends but will make citizens yearn for pennies," he added.

82.title: No plan to extend July 31 deadline for filing income tax returns: Govt
82.article_body: The government is not considering extending the July 31, 2022, deadline for filing income tax returns, Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj said on Friday. "People thought the routine now is that dates will be extended...They were a little slow in filing the returns initially," he told PTI. However, Bajaj said that 15-18 lakh income tax returns are being filed per day.

83.title: 19th century stolen painting of Maharaja Serfoji II traced to US museum
83.article_body: The stolen painting of Maharaja Serfoji II has been traced to a museum in the US, Idol Wing of Tamil Nadu Police said on Friday. The painting was reportedly stolen from Saraswathi Mahal. It was purchased by US' Peabody Essex Museum in 2006 from art dealer Subhash Kapoor for $35,000. He was arrested in 2011 for trafficking stolen Indian antiques.

84.title: AAP's time has come, not scared of jails: Kejriwal on CBI probe recommendation
84.article_body: After L-G VK Saxena recommended a CBI probe into the Arvind Kejriwal-led government's Excise Policy 2021-22, the Delhi Chief Minister said that AAP's time has come. "We are not scared of jails, not scared of the noose. They have made several cases against our people. The AAP has been growing since its win in Punjab...nothing will stop us," Kejriwal added.

85.title: Beacon of courage: Karan on Droupadi Murmu becoming President-elect
85.article_body: Bollywood celebrities have congratulated Droupadi Murmu on becoming the President-elect of India on social media. Karan Johar wrote, "A beacon of courage, resilience and inspiration." "Congratulations #DroupadiMurmu ma'am...Proud moment for the entire nation," Yami Gautam tweeted. Sunny Deol wrote, "Congratulations...Smt @DroupadiMurmu...you're an inspiring and a shining example of empowerment."

86.title: Election of Murmu bolstered people's trust in democracy: U'khand CM
86.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said election of tribal leader Droupadi Murmu as President of the country has bolstered people's trust in India's Constitution and democracy. "She represents a large section that had always been deprived, backward and at the end of society. That section is rejoicing," he added. Murmu was elected as the 15th President of India on Thursday.

87.title: Over 2,000 trains cancelled during Agnipath protests: Railways Minister
87.article_body: Minister for Railways Ashwini Vaishnaw on Friday informed the Parliament that 2,132 trains were cancelled between June 15 and June 23 during protests against the Centre's Agnipath defence recruitment scheme. Vaishnaw added that between June 14 and June 30, a total refund of approximately ₹102.96 crore was granted to passengers on account of the cancellation of trains.

88.title: People warned me about quitting 'Bhabi Ji...', but I don't regret it: Saumya
88.article_body: Actress Saumya Tandon said in an interview that she was warned about quitting 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai', in which she played the role of Anita Mishra. "Everyone told me...this was going to be very risky...But I thought it [was] risky to not take risks...I've never been scared or insecure," she added. Saumya further said she doesn't regret her decision.

89.title: Parents get worried about rumours linked to me, that bothers me: Kartik
89.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan said that initially rumours about him affected him. "I eventually learned not to pay attention to them. It's just that my parents get worried about these issues sometimes, and that bothers me...Rumours will come and go, and they eventually die down. No point in spending any time delving into them," he added.

90.title: I wouldn't term them as a big team: Smriti on CWG 2022 match vs Aus
90.article_body: Discussing the upcoming Commonwealth Games 2022 match between India Women and Australia Women, opener Smriti Mandhana said, "I wouldn't term Australia as a big team and make them feel good." Smriti added that the Indian team is aiming to win the gold medal. "I...got goosebumps when [javelin thrower] Neeraj Chopra got the gold [medal] at the Tokyo Olympics," she stated.

91.title: Kerala HC allows abortion to 13-yr-old girl impregnated by brother
91.article_body: Kerala High Court allowed a 13-year-old girl, who was impregnated by her minor brother, to get an abortion. During the hearing of the 30-week pregnant girl, the court said, "Easy availability of porn on the internet can mislead the juvenile minds of youngsters and give them wrong ideas." The authorities should review sexual education being imparted in schools, it added.

92.title: Pic shows astronauts' tracks on Moon 53 years after humans first landed on it
92.article_body: In order to commemorate 53 years of the Apollo 11 landing on the Moon, NASA recently shared a footage from the Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter. It shows "the astronauts' tracks, still there after all this time," wrote NASA. It was the first time that humans had stepped on the surface of another world.

93.title: ISI MARK helmet saves life: B'luru IPS officer as biker survives crash in Brazil
93.article_body: Dr BR Ravikanthe Gowda, an IPS officer from Bengaluru, shared a video showing a biker surviving after coming under a bus. The video showed the biker's head, covered with a helmet, slamming into a tyre of the bus. "Good quality ISI MARK helmet saves life," Gowda tweeted. The accident reportedly took place in Brazil and the biker was largely uninjured.

94.title: Samantha & I have some of the best love stories onscreen: Naga Chaitanya
94.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya recently said in an interview that he and his ex-wife actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu have had some of the best love stories together onscreen. The actor was asked which actress he has the best onscreen chemistry with. Naga Chaitanya and Samantha got married in 2017 and announced their separation on social media in 2021.

95.title: Supreme Court dismisses plea to increase smoking age from 18 to 21
95.article_body: Supreme Court has dismissed a plea seeking to increase the smoking age from 18 to 21 and ban the sale of loose cigarettes near educational and healthcare institutions and places of worship. A public interest litigation (PIL) was filed by two advocates. "If you want publicity, argue a good case...don't file publicity interest litigation," SC said while dismissing the plea.

96.title: We know that feeling when Indian flag goes up: Smriti ahead of CWG
96.article_body: India women's vice-captain Smriti Mandhana has said that their team is "aiming for gold" at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham, where women's cricket has been introduced for the first time. "We have watched the Commonwealth Games and Olympics and we know that feeling when the Indian flag goes up and when we hear the national anthem," Mandhana said.

97.title: Singapore carries out fifth execution since March
97.article_body: Singapore on Friday hanged a convicted drug trafficker, the fifth execution in the city-state since March. Nazeri bin Lajim was convicted in 2017 of possessing over 33 grams of heroin "for the purpose of trafficking". The list of those executed since March includes two Indian-origin men. Amnesty International has called on Singapore to "stop this relentless wave of hangings".

98.title: Family of 4 missing for over 1 month found dead in car in Punjab canal
98.article_body: The decomposed bodies of four members of a family were recovered from a car in the Sirhind Canal in Punjab's Faridkot on Friday. The family had been missing since June 11 after they went to Amritsar to visit the Golden Temple. The car was spotted by a passerby after it became visible as the water level in the canal receded.

99.title: Which regions have the highest and lowest CBSE Class 10 pass percentage?
99.article_body: CBSE on Friday declared results of Class 10 board exams, with the overall pass percentage being 94.40%. Trivandrum, which had the highest pass percentage of 98.83% in Class 12 exams, also topped in Class 10 with a pass percentage of 99.68%. Trivandrum is followed by Bengaluru (99.22%), Chennai (98.97%) and Ajmer (98.14%). Guwahati has the lowest pass percentage (82.23%).

100.title: New Zealand COVID death rate at record levels as it battles new wave
100.article_body: A record 151 people have died of COVID-19 in New Zealand in the seven days to July 16, Health Ministry data showed. This comes as the country battles new wave of COVID-19 infections fuelled by Omicron BA.5 sub-variant, which is particularly affecting the older population. In last 24 hours, 26 people died from COVID-19, all aged over 60, ministry said.

101.title: One-day cricket is dying a slow death: Usman Khawaja
101.article_body: Talking about ODI cricket following Ben Stokes' retirement from the same, Australia batter Usman Khawaja said he thinks one-day cricket is dying a slow death. He added that Test cricket is the pinnacle of the sport and T20I cricket is great entertainment and everyone loves it. He further said that ODI cricket is ranked third out of all three.

102.title: Centre trying to hinder AAP's work, they had been after Sisodia: AAP leader
102.article_body: After Delhi Lieutenant Governor (L-G) VK Saxena recommended a CBI investigation into Arvind Kejriwal-led government's Excise Policy 2021-22, AAP leader Saurabh Bharadwaj said that the Centre has been trying to hinder the work of the Arvind Kejriwal-led party. He added that they had been after Delhi's Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia after Health Minister Satyendar Jain's arrest.

103.title: 4 held for killing friend for damaging iPhone during brawl in UP
103.article_body: Uttar Pradesh's Sultanpur Police arrested four people on Thursday for allegedly murdering their friend who accidentally damaged an iPhone of one of the accused during a brawl. A country-made pistol was used to kill the deceased, according to the district's SP. The incident took place on July 10. The accused were traced using surveillance and CCTV footage.

104.title: Hoist Tricolour or display it in your homes between 13th and 15th August: PM to people
104.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday tweeted, "This year, when we are marking Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav, let us strengthen the Har Ghar Tiranga Movement. Hoist the Tricolour or display it in your homes between 13th and 15th August." "This movement will deepen our connect with the national flag," he wrote.

105.title: 51 couples get married in mass wedding ceremony in J&K's Srinagar
105.article_body: As many as 51 couples got married in a mass wedding ceremony in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar  on Thursday. The ceremony was organised by the NGO, 'We The Helping Hands Foundation'. The NGO's President said, "Many youths are not able to get married due to the dowry system and inflation...The motive was to help youth get married through simple ceremonies."

106.title: 3 soldiers killed in Israeli strikes near Damascus: Syrian state media
106.article_body: Three soldiers were killed and seven others were injured in an Israeli missile attack near Syria's Damascus on Friday, according to Syrian state media. A war monitor claimed that this was the 17th Israeli attack on Syrian territory this year. Notably, the Israeli military said that it does not comment on foreign reports.

107.title: Wouldn't like IPL to be a motivation in ODI series: WI batting coach
107.article_body: West Indies batting coach Monty Desai said he wouldn't want selection in the IPL to be a motivation for his players while playing the ODI series against India. "When you play an international game, your primary motive should be to represent your country in the best...way," added Monty. "We have encountered different layers of challenges [in ODIs]," he stated.

108.title: Hyderabad man arrested for allegedly molesting school children
108.article_body: A man in Hyderabad has been arrested for allegedly molesting students enrolled in his school. The accused, identified as Yasser, would reportedly lure children into a room by offering candies and molested them. He would also film the act. Parents had raised the issue with the school management, but when it refused to act against Yasser, they approached the police.

109.title: Mimi reacts to Ranveer's nude photoshoot, asks 'Would appreciation be same for a woman?'
109.article_body: Actress-politician Mimi Chakraborty, tweeting about Ranveer Singh's nude photoshoot, wrote, "Just wondering if the appreciation would have been same [for] a woman." "Or would you have...taken up morchas, given her...death threat and slut shamed her," she added. "We talk about equality where is that now??!!!!...It's your perspective that can change something or destroy it totally," Mimi wrote.

110.title: Google freezes hiring for 2 weeks to 'review headcount needs'
110.article_body: Google has announced that it will be freezing hiring for two weeks. In an email to the staff, Google's Senior Vice President Prabhakar Raghavan wrote, "We’ll use this time to review our headcount needs." This communication comes after the company recently announced that it would be slowing down its hiring process for the remaining year.

111.title: 39 deaths in Lonavala due to drowning since 2017; 29 in Bhushi Dam alone
111.article_body: At least 39 people lost their lives in Lonavala due to drowning, including 29 tourist deaths at Bhushi Dam, since 2017, as per data shared by police. "Despite warnings to tourists, they insist on climbing atop the rocks on the waterfall to click pictures. Most often, they choose to ignore our warnings, which leads to fatal accidents," an inspector said.

112.title: Mohammed Siraj, Umran Malik should be picked for T20 WC 2022: Gough
112.article_body: Talking about the upcoming T20 World Cup 2022, ex-England pacer Darren Gough said, "I would [include] Umran Malik, Mohammed Siraj, Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Jasprit Bumrah." "I have been impressed with Siraj when [I've seen] him bowl in Australia...Then you've got Umran...Anybody who bowls that speed gets into my squad...You might just need that extra...pace to shock the opposition," added Gough.

113.title: Opium worth ₹8 lakh seized in Delhi; 2 including MCD staff arrested
113.article_body: Police seized one kilogram of opium worth ₹8 lakh in Delhi's Dwarka and arrested two persons, including a 49-year-old permanent employee of the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD). One of the accused confessed to the crime and added that he used to cultivate opium in his field for medicinal purposes, but later began supplying it illegally.

114.title: 14-yr-old toys seller sleeping in Thane home dies as truck falls on her
114.article_body: A 14-year-old soft toys seller was killed while she was sleeping in her house along Mumbai-Nashik Highway after a truck fell on her on Friday morning. Reports said the girl was trapped under truck for over two hours. A crane was called to pull off the truck but she had died by then. Driver of truck ran away from spot.

115.title: Men hide ₹1.87 cr gold in undergarments & rectum, caught at Hyd airport
115.article_body: Air Intelligence Unit officials apprehended two male passengers at Hyderabad airport on Thursday for attempting to smuggle gold. The passengers, who had arrived from Dubai, had concealed 3.591-kg gold worth around ₹1.87 crore in undergarments and rectum. Officials also intercepted another passenger at Hyderabad airport for trying to smuggle 740-g gold by hiding it inside an exhaust fan and juicer.

116.title: 'The Ladykiller' has been intense, took break to get out of that space: Arjun
116.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor has said working on 'The Ladykiller' was a "mentally and emotionally" challenging experience for him. "The Ladykiller has been intense and raw for Bhumi (Pednekar) and I," he added. "That's why I went on holiday after that. I shot for about 45 days...and went away on a break...I needed to get out of that space," Arjun said.

117.title: Wasn't necessary: Dhanush on being called 'sexy Tamil friend' in Gray Man
117.article_body: Dhanush, during a press conference, answered a question about being referred to as a 'sexy Tamil friend' by Chris Evans' character in the Hollywood film 'The Gray Man'. He said it wasn't necessary but there was nothing wrong with it. "I think we were...adding more flavour and...it's absolutely fine...I'd appreciate if they...call us Indian actors, not North-South actors," Dhanush said.

118.title: Roofing firm organises pool party, barbecue for staff in UK on its hottest day ever
118.article_body: A UK-based company organised a pool party and barbecue in the building’s backyard on one of the hottest days of the year. Employees at HG Roofing Supplies also shared photos and videos from the pool party on social media. On Tuesday, the UK recorded its hottest day ever as the temperature crossed 40°C for the first time.

119.title: Sky over Australian town turns pink due to cannabis farm lighting, pics surface
119.article_body: The sky over Australian town of Mildura turned pink on Wednesday evening, with locals sharing pictures on social media and speculating the reason behind it. Pharmaceutical company Cann Group later confirmed that the lights were coming from its local cannabis farm, where the blackout blinds had been left open. "It was very bizarre," a local said.

120.title: Two girls score 500/500 marks in CBSE Class 12 exams
120.article_body: Yuvakshi Vig from Noida and Tanya Singh from Bulandshahr achieved a perfect score of 500/500 in their Class 12 CBSE exams. "I wasn't really expecting it. I had given all my attention to what I was doing and just hoped for the best possible outcome," Vig said. CBSE hasn't officially announced a country topper or toppers this year.

121.title: Most unique birds to go extinct in ongoing mass extinction: Study
121.article_body: Birds with the most unique physical features might go extinct in the ongoing mass extinction driven by climate crisis, a study warned. As per findings, these species with unique traits could be replaced with more widespread generalist species. Over 13% of the nearly 11,000 known bird species across the planet are threatened with extinction amid biodiversity crisis, the data stated.

122.title: It's been hard for me to watch England play well in Tests: Ponting
122.article_body: Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting said it has been hard for him to watch England play well in Tests. "I haven't [congratulated England Test coach Brendon McCullum]," added Ponting. England defeated India by seven wickets in the rescheduled fifth Test. Discussing 'Bazball', Ponting said, "When the real pressure of...Ashes...comes around, it'll be interesting to see if...[they] play...[this] way."

123.title: If we don't privatise Big Bash, then we might fall behind: Khawaja
123.article_body: Australian cricketer Usman Khawaja has suggested privatising the country's T20 tournament, Big Bash League, in order to make it competitive against other countries' T20 leagues. "There's a small window for the BBL to privatise in the next few years, and I'm afraid if we don't do that we'll fall behind...There are other tournaments starting up that are privatised," Khawaja said.

124.title: PFI’s political wing SDPI wins 3 municipal seats in MP's Neemuch
124.article_body: Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI), a political wing of the Popular Front of India (PFI), has won three municipal seats in Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch district. While SDPI's councillor candidates Arbina Bi and Jafar Shah won from wards 10 and 11 of Rampur municipality, defeating BJP candidates, Amna Bi won from ward 14 of Manasa, defeating a Congress candidate.

125.title: Traffic diversions on Bengaluru's Old Madras Road for white-topping work
125.article_body: The Bengaluru Traffic Police has implemented traffic diversions on some routes of the city's Old Madras Road in view of the relaying of a key arterial road with white topping. The stretches between Kensington Oval Road junction and Anjaneya Temple junction on Old Madras Road have been temporarily closed from July 21 onwards.

126.title: Earned enough for 3-4 generations in Nehru, Indira, Sonia's name: Cong leader
126.article_body: Karnataka Congress MLA KR Ramesh Kumar said Congress leader Sonia Gandhi should be morally relieved. "Only then two meals we eat will be worthwhile. We have earned enough for next three-four generations in the name of Nehru, Indira and Sonia Gandhi. If we are not prepared for...small sacrifice today...rice we eat will rot and have worms in future," he added.

127.title: India's 3rd case of monkeypox confirmed in man who returned to Kerala from UAE
127.article_body: Country's third monkeypox has been confirmed in a 35-year-old man who returned to Malappuram from UAE on July 6th, Kerala Health Minister Veena George said. "He was admitted with fever at Manjeri Medical College Hospital on 13th and from 15th he began showing symptoms. His family and close contacts are under observation," George added.

128.title: 50-yr-old man found hanging in Mumbai's Shivaji Park area
128.article_body: A 50-year-old man was found hanging inside a residential building in Dadar's Shivaji Park area in Mumbai. According to the police, the deceased, identified as Trimurti Markar, was a Worli resident and worked as a driver in the Shivaji Park area. Notably, it appears that the deceased allegedly killed himself and an accidental death case has been registered, police said.

129.title: Russia about to run out of steam in Ukraine: UK spy chief
129.article_body: Russia is "about to run out of steam" in Ukraine, the head of Britain's intelligence service MI6 said.  "I think our assessment is that the Russians will increasingly find it difficult to supply manpower over the next few weeks. They will have to pause in some way and that will give Ukrainians opportunities to strike back," Richard Moore added.

130.title: Hypocrisy Zindabad: Jairam accuses Modi of destroying Khadi makers
130.article_body: After PM Narendra Modi tweeted on the anniversary of the tri-colour being adopted as India's National Flag, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh criticised him by commenting, "Hypocrisy Zindabad". "From someone [Modi] who is destroying livelihoods of those who make [Khadi] national flags...From someone who was a pracharak in the organisation that took 52 years to hoist the National Flag," Ramesh tweeted.

131.title: CBSE declares Class 10 results
131.article_body: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) on Friday announced the Class 10 results. Students can access their results on https://cbseresults.nic.in. This year, over 21 lakh students appeared for CBSE Class 10 exams. Earlier today, CBSE declared Class 12 results, with 92.71% students passing the exams.

132.title: Bihar CM urges Railways Minister to rename station after local temple
132.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has written a letter to Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw urging him to rename Raghunathpur Railway Station in Buxar after Baba Brahmeshwar Nath temple, which is located in the same district. This comes as Kumar laid the foundation stone for the temple's beautification project on Thursday. Locals have been demanding the same for "several" years, Kumar said.

133.title: Pune civic body election office makes changes to 3.45 lakh voters
133.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) election office made changes to 3.45 lakh voters and published the final ward-wise voters' list on Thursday. "After receiving 4,273 objections...election office carried out site visits," an official said. "The maximum number of objections had to do with voters residing in one ward while their names had been added to adjacent wards," the official added.

134.title: School was running hostel without license: Official on Kallakurichi death
134.article_body: The Kallakurichi school where a student had died by suicide on July 13 was running hostel without a license, Saraswathi Rangasamy, the chairperson of the Tamil Nadu State Commission for Protection of Child Rights (TNCPCR), said. "This school hasn't taken any measures to apply for [the license] and it is a punishable offence," she added.

135.title: RBI has zero tolerance for rupee volatility & bumpy movements: Guv
135.article_body: As the Indian rupee touched new lows against the US dollar in the last few months, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said, "We have zero tolerance for volatile and bumpy movement of the rupee." He added that while the rupee is better placed than other currencies against the US dollar, the RBI continues to remain watchful of headwinds.

136.title: Struggled for 7 yrs, everybody who came after me was overtaking me: Sudeepa
136.article_body: Sharing his experience during his struggling days, actor Kichcha Sudeepa said, "It took me almost...seven years to give my first good film." "I [later went] through a low for almost six-seven years...everybody who came after me [was] overtaking [me]," added Sudeepa. "I lived on ₹500 per month...I used to work in a clothes store," he had earlier stated.

137.title: If BJP has courage, let ED put cameras while questioning Sonia: Baghel
137.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel said that if the Bharatiya Janata Party has courage, they should let the Enforcement Directorate to put cameras at the place where Congress leader Sonia Gandhi is being questioned in the National Herald case. "Do you have that kind of courage? The country wants to know where scam has taken place," Baghel added.

138.title: Work on Pune's Sus-Pashan bridge to be completed by end of August
138.article_body: The work on Pune's Sus-Pashan bridge has reached the final stage and will be completed by end of August, officials said. A PMC executive engineer said that the work on the last slab started on Thursday. "Due to...heavy rains, we can't continue tar laying work right now. Other works are going on with great speed," the PMC executive engineer added.

139.title: Man tries to stab US Congressman Zeldin during stump speech; held
139.article_body: US Congressman Lee Zeldin was attacked by a knife-wielding man on Thursday. Zeldin, the Republican candidate for New York Governor, was delivering a stump speech when a man climbed on stage "and attempted to stab" him. Zeldin said he grabbed the attacker's wrist and stopped him for a few moments before others tackled the man. The accused has been detained.

140.title: Heavy to extremely heavy rainfall warning issued for several states; list released
140.article_body: The IMD has issued heavy to extremely heavy rainfall warning for several states over next few days. Heavy rainfall is very likely over Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura during July 22-24. Very heavy rainfall is expected over Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh, Odisha, Tamil Nadu and Puducherry, while extremely heavy rainfall is likely over parts of Gujarat.

141.title: Lower Oshiwara does not exist, change name of metro station: Residents
141.article_body: The residents of Lokhandwala have written to the Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority demanding that the name Lower Oshiwara be changed. "There's no such place as Lower Oshiwara...moreover it'll...cause confusion...since next metro station on the same line is to be named Oshiwara," they said. "Hence, we request you to kindly change [its] name...to Lokhandwala," the residents added.

142.title: I have seen it 50 times: Ranbir on Sanjay Dutt-starrer 'Khalnayak'
142.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said he has seen the 1993 film 'Khalnayak' which starred actors Sanjay Dutt and Madhuri Dixit Nene 50 times. "I was deeply impacted by 'Khalnayak'. It was the coolest film...coolest hero we'd ever seen on screen," added Ranbir. Discussing his favourite pan-Indian star, Ranbir mentioned actor Prabhas, who is known for acting in the 'Baahubali' film franchise.

143.title: Apple Watch helped detect a rare tumour in my heart, saved my life: US woman
143.article_body: A US woman claimed that Apple Watch saved her life after it warned that her heart was beating in an irregular pattern. Kim Durkee said she initially thought the warnings were false but her doctors confirmed that she had myxoma, a rare, fast-growing tumour. Doctors said the tumour was choking off her heart's blood supply and could've caused a stroke.

144.title: Anupam to play Jayaprakash Narayan in Kangana's 'Emergency', 1st look out
144.article_body: Anupam Kher has been roped in to portray political leader Jayaprakash Narayan in 'Emergency', an upcoming film which will feature Kangana Ranaut as former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi. Anupam took to Instagram to share his look for the film and wrote, "Happy...to essay the role of the man who questioned fearlessly, a rebel in the truest sense of the word."

145.title: Mumbai lawyer gets 3-yr jail for molesting client's 16-yr-old daughter
145.article_body: A lawyer in Mumbai was sentenced to three years of rigorous imprisonment for molesting a client's 16-year-old daughter. He was helping the woman file an affidavit after she lost her crucial documents. He later offered the woman, who was living on rent, his neighbour's flat if she let him have physical relationship with her daughter and also touched her inappropriately.

146.title: SBSP chief OP Rajbhar, an SP ally, gets 'Y' security from UP govt
146.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has provided 'Y' category security to Suheldev Bharatiya Samaj Party (SBSP) chief Om Prakash Rajbhar. This comes after Rajbhar announced his support for NDA candidate Droupadi Murmu in the presidential election. Last month, Rajbhar had questioned SP chief Akhilesh Yadav's absence from campaigning for the Lok Sabha bypolls to Azamgarh and Rampur seats.

147.title: 8 arrested for offering namaz in public in Haridwar
147.article_body: Eight people were arrested for offering namaz at a weekly market in Haridwar, Uttarakhand. However, the accused were later granted bail by the sub-divisional magistrate's (SDM) court, police said. The accused were identified as Nizam (22), Nasim (52), Sajjad Ahmad (50), Mursalin (38), Ashraf (45), Asgar (37), Mustafa (35) and Ikram (47), and were arrested in Haridwar's Shivalik Nagar colony.

148.title: Johar denies favouring Janhvi on 'Koffee...', says 'Everybody read it wrong'
148.article_body: Karan Johar has responded to accusations of being biased towards Janhvi Kapoor and sidelining Sara Ali Khan on 'Koffee With Karan 7'. "That's completely untrue," Johar said, adding, "I was...feeling bad because Janhvi lost both rounds. She lost...rapid fire round and...the game round. I was perhaps just trying to be nice. In that process, I think everybody read it wrong."

149.title: 10 paedophiles travelled to Poland after Ukraine invasion: UK
149.article_body: British paedophiles have been travelling to Poland claiming they're providing "humanitarian assistance" to refugees fleeing war in Ukraine, UK's National Crime Agency said. Ten known sex offenders have travelled to Poland in the six weeks following the war, it added. "All 10 were asked to leave following an interview with Polish immigration...and law enforcement," the agency further said.

150.title: We can be Vishwa Guru only when Population Control Bill is brought: BJP MP
150.article_body: BJP MP Ravi Kishan will introduce a private member's bill on population control in Parliament on Friday. "We can be Vishwa Guru only when the Population Control Bill is brought. [It is] very important to bring the population under control. With the way in which it's rising, we're heading towards an explosion," said the Gorakhpur MP.

151.title: Sonia Gandhi didn't tell ED to end questioning: Jairam Ramesh
151.article_body: "The allegations that ED stopped investigation as Sonia Gandhi requested to leave because she is suffering from COVID-19 are baseless," Congress leader Jairam Ramesh clarified after reports stating that Sonia asked ED officials to stop questioning her in the National Herald case surfaced. "The interrogation ended because ED didn't have anything to ask," he added.

152.title: Minister says ₹15 for corn is high in MP, adds 'it's free here'; shares video
152.article_body: Union Minister of State in the Ministry of Steel and Ministry of Rural Development, Faggan Singh Kulaste took to Twitter to share a video of his interaction with a corn seller in Madhya Pradesh. In the video, Kulaste can be seen telling the corn seller that ₹15 per corncob is "too high" and that "it is sold for free here".

153.title: Educational institutions closed in UP's Moradabad on July 25, 26 amid Kanwar Yatra
153.article_body: All educational institutions in Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad will be closed on July 25 and July 26 keeping in view the annual Kanwar Yatra, the district administration said. Many pilgrims will be offering prayers at temples and to prevent traffic jams and rush during these days, all the educational institutions will remain closed on Monday and Tuesday, the official order reads.

154.title: BYJU's owes ₹86.21 crore to BCCI; Paytm wants to exit as title sponsor: Report
154.article_body: Indian cricket team’s jersey sponsor BYJU's allegedly owes ₹86.21 crore as dues to the BCCI, as per a report. It further said that Paytm has requested BCCI to assign their India Home Cricket title rights to Mastercard. While BCCI's agreement with BYJU's was extended till the 2023 ODI World Cup, its agreement with Paytm is valid till March 31, 2023.

155.title: Man swallows heroin capsules worth ₹8.86 crore, held at TN airport
155.article_body: Customs officials have seized heroin worth ₹8.86 crore at the airport in Tamil Nadu's Chennai and arrested a man, who is a Tanzanian national, in connection to this. The accused had swallowed 86 capsules containing 1.26 kg of the drug, which were extracted from him. According to a release, the accused arrived in Chennai from Uganda's Entebbe on July 14.

156.title: LG VK Saxena calls for CBI probe into Delhi government's excise policy
156.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena called for a CBI probe into the alleged violation of the Delhi Excise Policy. This comes after Delhi Chief Secretary filed a report showing prima facie violations of various policies. There were "deliberate and gross procedural lapses" made by Manish Sisodia. Delhi government allegedly extended "undue favours" to liquor licensees after tenders had been awarded.

157.title: You'll never see my house, I don't allow guests to click pics: Ranveer
157.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said he doesn't allow guests to take pictures of his house. "You'll never see my house," added Ranveer. Talking about life, Ranveer stated, "Life is an agonising...journey. If I'm angry, I get really...angry...I get overwhelmed...[daily]." Having recently posed nude, Ranveer said, "In some...performances I've been...f**king naked...I can be naked in front of...thousand people."

158.title: BJP wants to tarnish the image of Gandhi family: Adhir Chowdhury
158.article_body: After the Enforcement Directorate questioned Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Thursday, party leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury alleged that BJP wants to tarnish the Gandhi family's image. "Will anybody...believe that the party that was in power for 54 years will commit a scam of ₹90 crore that too by...Sonia and Rahul Gandhi whose family members sacrificed their lives," Chowdhury asked.

159.title: 7-Eleven fires around 800 employees in US citing business restructuring
159.article_body: Convenience store chain 7-Eleven has fired about 800 people in the US citing business restructuring. The chain is owned by the Japanese retail conglomerate Seven & i Holdings. Last year in May, the 7-Eleven store chain completed the $21 billion acquisition of its rival Speedway convenience store chain from Marathon Petroleum.

160.title: Cristiano Ronaldo's agent Mendes offered him to Barca: Report
160.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo's agent Jorge Mendes reportedly offered him to Barcelona before they signed Bayern Munich's Robert Lewandowski. Ronaldo was willing to accept a significant pay cut, the report added. Ronaldo is Real Madrid's all-time record goalscorer, having scored 451 goals in 438 matches, winning two LaLiga titles and four Champions League trophies. He currently represents Manchester United.

161.title: Airbnb Co-founder Joe Gebbia steps back from leadership role after 14 years
161.article_body: Airbnb's Co-founder Joe Gebbia has announced that he will step back from his full-time operating role at the company. "The primary reason for this transition is that...my brain is bursting with more ideas to bring to the world," Gebbia said. Gebbia founded Airbnb with his roommate Brian Chesky as they were looking to raise money to afford their apartment's rent.

162.title: My life changed after my father said 'I can't pay your loans': Samantha
162.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu said she didn't have a choice but to act due to her family struggling financially. "My father said..., 'I can't pay your loans,' that changed my life," added Samantha. Discussing the worst thing read about herself, Samantha mentioned reading about her getting ₹250 crore in alimony following her divorce with actor Nagarjuna Akkineni's son Naga Chaitanya.

163.title: I'm doing great: US Prez Biden after testing positive for COVID-19
163.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said that he's "doing great" after testing positive for COVID-19. The 79-year-old, who's fully vaccinated and has twice received booster jabs, posted a video on Twitter, saying that he was "getting a lot of work done" and would continue with his duties. Biden will work in isolation until he tests negative, the White House said.

164.title: Truck hits girl as driver suffers heart attack in Punjab; driver dies
164.article_body: A truck hit a 14-year-old girl who was walking on the road in Punjab's Dhakoli on Thursday after the driver suffered a heart attack and lost control over the vehicle. The truck driver, who was declared dead at a hospital, was thrashed by onlookers who weren't aware of his medical emergency, police said. The girl was injured in the incident.

165.title: Video shows students kissing during 'truth and dare' game in K'taka; 1 student detained
165.article_body: A video of a boy and a girl, both students of a reputed Karnataka college kissing during a 'truth and dare' game has surfaced on social media. The boy who made the video has reportedly been detained for questioning. City police commissioner N Shashi Kumar said the incident had taken place six months ago at a private flat.

166.title: Will sit with photographers, they'll understand: Ranbir on attention after baby
166.article_body: While talking about media attention after his baby arrives, actor Ranbir Kapoor said that he will sit and have a conversation with the photographers. "I will sit down with them. They are lovely people, if you sit down with them and say something which means something to you, I think they will understand," he added.

167.title: Call me that, I don't care: Akshay on 'Canadian Kumar' tag
167.article_body: During the latest episode of 'Koffee With Karan Season 7', host Karan Johar asked Akshay Kumar if he gets trolled, to which the actor replied he doesn't go online much. "At...most, they write about Canada. Which I don't care," he added. When Karan pointed out that trolls call him 'Canada Kumar', Akshay said, "Yeah Canada Kumar. Okay, call me that."

168.title: Vedaant is getting a lot more attention than he actually deserves: Madhavan
168.article_body: R Madhavan has said his 16-year-old son, swimmer Vedaant, is getting a lot more attention than he actually deserves. Vedaant recently broke the national junior record in 1,500m freestyle swimming and won a gold medal at the Danish Open in April. "There are...better students than him in his age group in India...They need to be celebrated as well," Madhavan added.

169.title: African swine fever reported from 2 farms in Kerala's Wayanad
169.article_body: African swine fever has been reported among pigs from two farms at Mananthavady in Kerala's Wayanad, officials said. This comes after samples were tested at the National Institute of High Security Animal Diseases in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal. "Now the test result has confirmed the infection. Directions have been issued to cull 300 pigs of the second farm," an official said.

170.title: 11 people arrested for selling foreign cigarettes illegally in Noida
170.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Police and the district tobacco control committee together arrested 11 people for selling packets of cigarettes of foreign brands in Noida. Six shops in Sector 18 and five shops in Sector 57-61 area were found possessing foreign-brand cigarettes which did not comply with the Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Products Act (COTPA), police said.

171.title: At least 18 people killed in police raid in Rio de Janeiro
171.article_body: At least 18 people were killed during a raid in a dense warren of Rio de Janeiro slums on Thursday. Sixteen of the dead were alleged criminals, while a police officer and a bystander were the other victims, police said. The raid allegedly targeted a criminal group involved in cargo theft, bank robberies and was planning operations in rival slums.

172.title: Mumbai man sends obscene messages, videos to over 600 women; arrested
172.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested in Mumbai for allegedly hacking several WhatsApp accounts and sending obscene messages and videos to over 600 women. He intended to chat with the women and lure them to meet him, police said. The accused, who works as a data entry operator in a private bank, had been hacking WhatsApp accounts since 2019, police added.

173.title: UP launches scheme for cashless medical benefits for state employees, pensioners
173.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath launched a scheme to provide cashless medical facilities for state employees and pensioners at government-run institutions and medical colleges without any financial limit. The scheme will benefit around 22 lakh state government employees, pensioners and their dependents. A health card would be provided to the eligible employees and pensioners, Adityanath said.

174.title: Cyberabad police share video, ask people to drive slow on wet roads
174.article_body: Cyberabad Traffic Police on Friday shared a video of an accident and urged people to drive slow as "sudden braking can cause skidding of the vehicle on wet roads".
