Three people died in the accident which took place in Shamshabad, traffic police said. The video of the accident shows the vehicle skidding on the road and hitting another parked vehicle.

175.title: Akasa Air opens booking for flights in 4 cities; to operate 1st flight on Aug 7
175.article_body: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air has opened bookings for flights between Ahmedabad, Bengaluru, Mumbai, and Kochi from July 22. The airline said it has opened ticket sales for 28 weekly flights that it will be operating on the Mumbai-Ahmedabad route from August 7, as well as for 28 weekly flights it will be operating on the Bengaluru-Kochi route from August 13.

176.title: 2 13-yr-old kids with illness become B'luru DCPs for a few hrs, pics surface
176.article_body: Two 13-year-old children who are battling "difficult" illnesses became Deputy Commissioners of Police for few hours in Bengaluru. IPS officer CK Baba, the Deputy Commissioner of Police, shared pictures of children in police uniforms. "A humbling day as I stood in attention to DCPs for day...we played small part in making their wish come true...for few hours only," he wrote.

177.title: Dinesh Gunawardena appointed as new Prime Minister of Sri Lanka
177.article_body: Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe on Friday appointed senior politician Dinesh Gunawardena as the new Prime Minister of the country. Wickremesinghe is also expected to appoint his new cabinet today, a day after he was sworn into Sri Lanka's highest office. Earlier, security forces raided the main anti-government protest camp in the capital.

178.title: Fake doctor who prescribed medicines to patients booked in Pune
178.article_body: A case was filed against a fake doctor on Thursday for allegedly prescribing allopathic medicines to patients for his own financial benefits without proper knowledge in Pune's Narayangaon. The accused had reportedly put the initials 'Dr' in front of his name on the clinic's board. Police officials said that the accused had failed to submit necessary documents after being asked.

179.title: Jharkhand woman police constable, mother and daughter found dead at home
179.article_body: The bodies of a woman police constable, her mother and her daughter were found at the quarters made for the staff in policeline in Jharkhand's Jamshedpur, police said. "She had not been seen for the past two days. The door was locked from outside," Jamshedpur SSP Prabhat Kumar said. The locals reportedly became suspicious when a foul smell started emanating.

180.title: Japan to hold assassinated ex-PM Abe's state funeral on Sept 27
180.article_body: Japan will hold a state funeral for assassinated former PM Shinzo Abe on September 27 at Tokyo's Nippon Budokan, the government announced. The funeral will be fully paid for by state funds, Chief Cabinet Secretary Hirokazu Matsuno said. Activists and opposition parties have opposed the plan, saying the state shouldn't spend public money on an event for a political leader.

181.title: Which regions have the highest and lowest CBSE Class 12 pass percentage?
181.article_body: CBSE on Friday declared results of Class 12 board exams. Among regions, Trivandrum has the highest pass percentage of 98.83% followed by Bengaluru which has a pass percentage of 98.16%. Chennai, Delhi East and Delhi West are among the top 5 regions. Prayagraj has the lowest pass percentage of 83.71%. The overall pass percentage stood at 92.71% this year.

182.title: Studying History makes you cultured, Maths makes you retarded: Janhvi
182.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said she only cared about History and Literature while studying in school, adding those subjects can make someone a "cultured human". "Maths...makes you...retarded," added Janhvi. "I don't understand the point of [learning Maths]. Itna kyu maine sar toda?...I have not used algebra till now...What's the point?" she stated. Janhvi was recently seen in 'Koffee with Karan 7'.

183.title: Oppn unity is bit of chimera: Omar on TMC abstaining from VP poll voting
183.article_body: National Conference leader Omar Abdullah on Thursday reacted to TMC's decision to abstain from voting in Vice President elections, saying, "Opposition unity is a bit of a chimera." He added that "ultimately" political parties do what's in their own interest. Furthermore, he said that it's time for National Conference to do what suits it "rather than waste time chasing ghosts".

184.title: Man stabs himself, fakes robbery story to get family’s money in Gurugram
184.article_body: A 29-year-old man allegedly stabbed himself at his residence in Gurugram and faked a robbery story to siphon off his family's money. The man had claimed that four unidentified men posing as Wi-Fi technicians entered his house when he was alone and took away cash and valuables kept at home. Based on CCTV footage, police found that he was lying.

185.title: Ford rolls out last car from Chennai plant as it ends production in India
185.article_body: Ford India rolled out its last car, EcoSport, from its Chennai manufacturing plant in Tamil Nadu ahead of its formal closure of the unit. Last year, Ford announced that it will end its manufacturing operations in India due to losses. Several visuals of the last unit decorated with flowers and balloons, along with the staff were shared on social media.

186.title: India reports 21,880 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,49,482
186.article_body: India has reported 21,880 COVID-19 cases and 60 related deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 21,566 COVID-19 cases. The number of active coronavirus cases in India stands at 1,49,482, according to the latest data. The total death toll so far has reached 5,25,930.

187.title: Case against Mukhtar Ansari after diary in 31-yr-old case goes missing
187.article_body: A case was registered against Uttar Pradesh politician Mukhtar Ansari on Wednesday in connection with the disappearance of the original diary of the 31-year-old Awadhesh Rai murder case, police said. FIR was registered for hatching a conspiracy to get the original case diary to disappear. The hearing of the case is being held in the MP-MLA court of Varanasi.

188.title: US reports its 1st polio case in nearly a decade
188.article_body: An adult in New York has become the first US resident in nearly a decade to contract polio, state health officials said. Officials further said that the person was unvaccinated, adding that how or where the infected resident was exposed remains under evaluation. The last known US case of polio virus was recorded in 2013.

189.title: He was good: Kartik reacts to Ranveer mimicking him on 'Koffee...'
189.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has reacted to Ranveer Singh imitating him on Karan Johar's 'Koffee With Karan 7'. He said that he hasn't seen the episode yet, but has watched the clip of Ranveer. "He is really watching my videos. He was good," Kartik said, adding, "But, I actually say 'thank you' and not just mime it."

190.title: FIFA 23 game briefly listed for ₹4.8 instead of ₹4,799 on Epic Games store
190.article_body: Epic Games briefly listed the FIFA 23 Ultimate Edition game for about ₹4.8 instead of its actual price of ₹4,799 on its store. The listing error took about 30 minutes to be fixed, allowing several users in India to place pre-orders for the game. As per reports, users from other regions were also able to buy the game for ₹4.8.

191.title: Your per day fee is my salary for entire film: Samantha on Akshay
191.article_body: During her appearance on 'Koffee with Karan 7' alongside actor Akshay Kumar, actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu said his per day fee while starring in a film is equal to her salary for an entire movie. Discussing things he won't do for money, Akshay stated, "There is a price for everything." Samantha featured in the song 'Oo Antava' from 'Pushpa'.

192.title: Anil debuted in South, Sridevi was South actress: Vijay on North-South debate
192.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda said that the North and South industries have always worked together and that "now it's loud". "Anil Kapoor sir debuted down South. Directors have been making films up North. Sridevi ma'am has been a South actor...It's just that now we are doing cinema that the entire country watches and it's about time that this happens," he added.

193.title: Madhavan, son Vedaant meet Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik, actor shares pics
193.article_body: R Madhavan, his wife Sarita Birje and their son Vedaant recently met Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik. The actor shared pictures on his Instagram handle, in which Patnaik could be seen giving an Odisha jersey to Vedaant. "Thank you...for the...hospitality and the most fantastic endeavour of putting Odisha firmly on one of the Best Sports Venue [maps]...of India," Madhavan wrote.

194.title: CBSE announces Class 12 results
194.article_body: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) on Friday announced the Class 12 results. Students can access their results on https://cbseresults.nic.in. Alternatively, candidates can check their results via the DigiLocker app. This year, over 14 lakh students appeared for CBSE Class 12 exams.

195.title: Bengaluru reports 1,285 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
195.article_body: Bengaluru reported 1,285 new COVID-19 cases and 1,242 recoveries, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said on Thursday. The number of active cases was 7,107, while the infection positivity rate stood at 6.32%. No deaths were reported in this period. Nearly two crore vaccines have been administered so far in the city.

196.title: Man kills daughter, attacks family over tea in Northeast Delhi
196.article_body: A 45-year-old man allegedly attacked his family with glass shard following a dispute over tea in Northeast Delhi. While his 18-year-old daughter died of injuries, his wife and two other daughters were wounded. The accused had asked his daughters to buy milk for tea, but his wife told him to do it himself, which led to an argument, police said.

197.title: Bengaluru to get AI-powered traffic cameras at 50 intersections
197.article_body: Bengaluru will get artificial intelligence-powered Red Light Violation Detection (RLVD) cameras at 50 traffic intersections, according to authorities. These cameras will be able to detect eight violations, including not wearing seatbelt, overspeeding, triple riding, one-way riding, using a cell phone, crossing stop lines and riding without a helmet. The cameras will be installed in August.

198.title: Ex-US policeman gets 2.5 years in jail over George Floyd's murder
198.article_body: A former US policeman has been jailed for two-and-a-half years for violating African-American George Floyd's civil rights. Thomas Lane was found guilty of showing "deliberate indifference" to the medical needs of Floyd when former police officer Derek Chauvin pinned the handcuffed Floyd's neck to the ground with a knee for more than nine minutes in May 2020, causing his death.

199.title: Gauhati HC grants bail to 19-yr-old student held under UAPA for FB post
199.article_body: Gauhati High Court granted bail to the 19-year-old college student, Barshashree Buragohain, who was arrested under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) for allegedly writing an "anti-national poem" on Facebook. Buragohain's post allegedly supported militant group ULFA(I). Notably, the post made no mention of the outfit. The lines "were an implicit endorsement of ULFA(I)", FIR stated.

200.title: Video shows Donald Trump refusing to say 'the election is over' after losing
200.article_body: A video from January 7, 2021 shows the then US President Donald Trump refusing to say that "the election is over" after losing. The video was released by the committee probing the attack on US Capitol. "I just want to say Congress has certified the results without saying the election is over," Trump can be heard saying in the video.

201.title: 3 arrested for stealing 280m of cables from Rapid Metro Line in Gurugram
201.article_body: Three men were arrested for allegedly stealing 280 metres of copper cables worth ₹9 lakh from the Rapid Metro Line in Gurugram. The suspects revealed they had sold the stolen copper cables for ₹2 lakh to a scrap dealer and had conducted two similar thefts in Delhi as well, police said. Notably, two of the suspects were arrested from Ghaziabad.

202.title: Instagram videos less than 15 minutes to be now shared as Reels
202.article_body: Instagram has announced that videos that are shorter than 15 minutes will now be shared as Reels. However, it added that videos posted prior to this change won’t become Reels. The company also said that videos and Reels will now be consolidated under one tab on a user’s profile to create a single home for all their videos.

203.title: Needed money to buy my house, got it after more 'Jaani..' screen time: Akshay
203.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar said he needed money to buy house he currently lives in and that became possible after his on-screen timing was increased in 'Jaani Dushman' after another actor could not come for shoot as he was stuck. "I was on per-day basis...villain kills me [in movie]...I [went to] director [and said] 'Should I come back?'" Akshay added.

204.title: 2 Indian brothers, their friend charged in first crypto insider trading case in US
204.article_body: Two Indian brothers and their Indian-American friend have been charged in the first-ever insider trading scheme involving cryptocurrencies in US. Former Coinbase manager Ishan Wahi, his brother Nikhil Wahi and Sameer Ramani used confidential information about which crypto assets were set to be listed on the platform's exchanges. They made illegal trades, realising $1.5 million in illicit profits.

205.title: Eldhose creates history, becomes 1st Indian to reach triple jump final at World C'ships
205.article_body: Eldhose Paul has created history by becoming the first-ever Indian to reach triple jump final in the history of World Athletics Championships. The 25-year-old advanced to the final with a best jump of 16.68 metres. He finished 12th in the qualification round. The final will take place on Sunday (IST).

206.title: US-based firm Meta.is to sue Meta for stealing its name
206.article_body: A US-based virtual reality company META.is is suing Meta for allegedly stealing its name and violating the company’s established brand. Meta.is in a post wrote, "Facebook seized our META mark and name, which we put our blood, sweat and tears into building for over 12 years." It added that it had discussed a potential partnership with Facebook in 2017.

207.title: 2nd autopsy conducted in my absence: Kallakurichi student's father to SC
207.article_body: The father of the 17-year-old Class 12 girl student, who allegedly died by suicide in Tamil Nadu's Kallakurichi, claimed that her second autopsy was conducted in his absence. He had moved the SC seeking a particular team of doctors in the panel constituted to do the second post-mortem. The father withdrew his petition seeking a stay on the second autopsy.

208.title: Delhi govt to begin coaching classes for underprivileged class 10, 12 students
208.article_body: Delhi government will begin special classes for class 10 and 12 students from marginalised backgrounds starting next week under the Jai Bhim Mukhyamantri Pratibha Vikas Yojna. Under this programme, the government provides free coaching to talented students of scheduled castes, scheduled tribes and poor families for competitive exams like JEE, medical and civil services.

209.title: Pune police arrest 2 people for cheating 4 BJP MLAs of ₹3,400 each
209.article_body: A Pune police official said on Thursday that two people were arrested for allegedly cheating four BJP MLAs of ₹3,400 each after one of the duo sought the money claiming that his mother was hospitalised. The accused had reportedly required the money for daily needs. The duo was nabbed using a telephonic tracing system, DCP (Zone 5) Namrata Patil said.

210.title: 2nd youngest kid in India with rare disorder gets bariatric surgery in Mumbai
210.article_body: A 20-month old child, Ibrahim Khan, has become the second youngest child in India to undergo bariatric surgery in India. According to reports, he has Leptin receptor (LepR) deficiency. His surgery was performed in Mumbai. His elder sister Zoya, now 12 years old, also has same genetic disorder and was the youngest in the country to undergo bariatric surgery.

211.title: Sri Lankan troops raid main anti-govt protest camp as new Prez takes over
211.article_body: Sri Lankan security forces have raided the main anti-government protest camp in the capital Colombo and cleared out a section of it. The troops armed with batons and assault rifles swooped in on protesters camping at the Presidential Secretariat, saying the protesters have "no legal right to hold it". This comes after Ranil Wickremesinghe was sworn in as President.

212.title: Man jailed for sexually assaulting 5-yr-old girl: Rachakonda Police
212.article_body: Rachakonda Police said on Friday that a sessions court has sentenced a 67-year-old man to three years in jail on charges of sexually assaulting a five-year-old girl in 2015. The police added that Rachakonda Police Commissioner Mahesh Bhagwat and Additional Police Commissioner G Sudheer Babu announced a reward for the IO, CDO and Additional Public Prosecutor for their efforts.

213.title: 2 Indians to feature in men's javelin throw final at World C'ships for 1st time
213.article_body: Neeraj Chopra and Rohit Yadav have qualified for the men's javelin throw final at the World Athletics Championships 2022. With this, two Indians will feature in the men's javelin throw final at World Athletics Championships for the first time in history. Chopra qualified with a best throw of 88.39 metres, while Yadav qualified with a best throw of 80.42 metres.

214.title: $80 billion wiped off combined m-cap of companies that sell online ads in a day
214.article_body: About $80 billion was wiped out of the combined market value of companies that sell online ads after Snap reported poor quarterly results. While shares of Alphabet fell 3%, wiping out over $40 billion from its market capitalisation, Meta Platforms dropped 5%, erasing about $25 billion in market value. Snap shares fell 25%, cutting its market value by $7 billion.

215.title: Who cares, do I look 55: Akshay Kumar on working with younger actresses
215.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar said that those who criticise him for working with younger actresses are "jealous". "I can work with them. Do I look 55? I don't understand the problem. They just get jealous and keep on writing it. Some media person will write and some trolling will happen. Who cares?" he added.

216.title: 35-year-old drunk man kills 60-year-old father in Pune, arrested
216.article_body: A 35-year-old man has been arrested for killing his 60-year-old father in Pune, police said. The accused, who was in an inebriated state, had a heated argument with his father when the murder took place on July 15, police added. The incident came to light after the deceased's brother suspected his nephew as he was missing after the incident.

217.title: If you put us both in a room, you have to hide sharp objects: Samantha on ex-husband
217.article_body: While talking about her ex-husband Naga Chaitanya on Koffee with Karan Season 7, Samantha Ruth Prabhu said, "Like if you put us both in a room, you have to hide sharp objects." Samantha said this when Karan Johar asked if there were any hard feelings between her and Naga. She added that the situation was not amicable right now.

218.title: It's a good motivation to work out: Musk on jokes over his Mykonos shirtless pics
218.article_body: Responding to a Twitter user over jokes about his recent shirtless pictures in Mykonos, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said, "It's good motivation to work out, eat healthier and maybe take my shirt off outside more than once a year." The user had tweeted, "Anyone posting a shirtless pic of Musk...must...post a shirtless picture of themselves for comparison".

219.title: IAS officer shares his Class 10 marksheet, jokes 'It remained classified since 1997'
219.article_body: IAS officer Shahid Choudhary shared a picture of his Class 10 marksheet, revealing he got 339/500 marks. He wrote, "On students' demand...here's my...marksheet which remained 'classified' since 1997." Responding to a comment on his low marks in Mathematics and Social Studies, he wrote, "Friends proved helpful in Mathematics...while I...avenged Social Studies' [marks] by taking Sociology in UPSC."

220.title: 27-yr-old woman killed as her car crashes into metro pillar in Gurugram
220.article_body: A 27-year-old woman was killed after her car allegedly crashed into a metro pillar on Golf Course Road in Gurugram on Wednesday, police said. When her daughter was returning home after meeting her friends, an unknown vehicle being driven rashly hit her daughter's car from the side, the woman's mother claimed. "Her car got imbalanced...rammed into the pillar," she added.

221.title: Who were the top remittance recipients among low and middle income nations in 2021?
221.article_body: As per a WHO report, India was the top remittance recipient in 2021 among low and middle income countries. India received $87 billion in remittance in 2021, the report said. India is followed by China and Mexico ($53 billion each). Meanwhile, Philippines and Egypt received $36 billion and $33 billion in remittance, respectively.

222.title: 3 arrested in Delhi for trafficking tribal women in guise of placement agency
222.article_body: Delhi Police on Monday rescued 10 tribal women, including six minors, from the premises of an illegal placement agency in Mukundpur. Of the four identified as accused in the case, three have been arrested and the prime accused is still absconding. Prime accused had organised the entire syndicate of getting girls from Jharkhand over a period of time, police said.

223.title: Navi Mumbai man injured after ceiling plaster falls on him while sleeping
223.article_body: A 52-year-old man escaped with injuries after plaster from the ceiling of a City and Industrial Development Corporation (CIDCO)-constructed building fell on him in Navi Mumbai. The false ceiling neutralised the plaster's impact to some extent, the man said. Residents said this was the fourth incident of plaster falling since the man has been living in the house since 2003.

224.title: 4 held for alleged robbery, extortion in B'luru; ₹6 lakh recovered
224.article_body: Bengaluru Police have caught four people accused of involvement in extortion and robbery cases at multiple locations in the city. The police also recovered five two-wheeler vehicles and 20 mobile phones, the total of which is said to be around ₹6 lakh. All mobile phones were used for extortion and other illegal activities by the gang, reports said.

225.title: Neeraj Chopra qualifies for World C'ships final with 3rd best throw of his career
225.article_body: Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra has qualified for the men's javelin throw final at the World Athletics Championships 2022 with the third-best throw of his career. The 24-year-old advanced to the final by producing a best throw of 88.39 metres in his first attempt in the qualification round. The final will take place on Sunday (IST).

226.title: Pujara slams 3rd double ton in county this season; Sundar, Saini take five-wicket hauls
226.article_body: Chesteshwar Pujara slammed his third double hundred for Sussex in the ongoing county season. While, Washington Sundar and Navdeep Saini took five-wicket hauls for their county debut for Lancashire and Kent, respectively. Pujara slammed the double ton against Middlesex at Lord's while Sundar and Saini took their five-wicket hauls against Northamptonshire and Warwickshire, respectively.

227.title: 25-km Kanwar yatra to spread gender equality message in U'khand on July 26
227.article_body: A 25-km Kanwar yatra to spread the message of gender equality will be held in Uttarakhand on July 26. The yatra will start at Har Ki Pairi and end with a 'jalabhishek' at Veerbhadra temple in Rishikesh. State Women Empowerment Minister Rekha Arya, yoga guru Baba Ramdev and Panchdashnam Joona Akhada chief patron Harigiri Maharaj will be present there.

228.title: Real fascism: Cong as TV anchor booked for 'criticising' Kerala MP
228.article_body: Leader of Opposition in the Kerala Assembly, VD Satheesan, criticised police for booking Asianet TV news anchor Vinu V John for a comment he allegedly made during a TV discussion in March. John had made some observations regarding Elamaram Kareem, a Rajya Sabha MP from Kerala. Satheesan said booking an anchor for "raising criticism" against an MP is "real fascism".

229.title: 23-yr-old dies by suicide over fall in viewership on YouTube channel
229.article_body: A 23-year-old man allegedly died by suicide in Hyderabad on Thursday reportedly due to fall in number of viewers on his YouTube channel, officials said. The deceased was a student of IIITM, Gwalior and was currently attending classes online. Police said he jumped from the third floor of his residential building in the morning and died on the spot.

230.title: Spain, Portugal resist EU calls to cut gas consumption by 15%
230.article_body: Spain and Portugal on Thursday said they would not support the European Commission's proposal to reduce gas consumption by 15% amidst fears that Russia could cut off supplies ahead of winter. Madrid and Lisbon said they use very little Russian gas in comparison to other EU nations and their energy supplies are very different from the rest of Europe.

231.title: UK's Supreme Court to hear Scotland's independence case in October
231.article_body: The UK Supreme Court on Thursday said it will hear arguments on whether Scotland can conduct an independence referendum without the British government's approval in October this year. Pro-independence Scottish leader Nicola Sturgeon said Scotland's plebiscite on secession will be held on October 19, 2023. Outgoing Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s government has denied any such vote now.

232.title: Tantrik allegedly promises to land woman job using witchcraft, rapes her in Raj
232.article_body: A 27-year-old married woman has alleged that a 40-year-old tantrik has been raping her for the past one year in Rajasthan, police said. The woman also claimed that the accused, named Champalal, recorded some obscene videos and blackmailed her. The woman stated that she fell in Champalal's trap after he promised to land her a job using witchcraft, police said.

233.title: Passengers de-boarded after bomb scare on Patna-Delhi IndiGo flight, plane being checked
233.article_body: All 134 passengers were de-boarded at Patna airport after a bomb scare on a Patna-Delhi IndiGo flight on Thursday night. The plane is being checked by bomb disposal squad, said reports. According to reports, a passenger of the flight himself said that he is carrying a bomb in the bag.

234.title: Roof collapse kills four of a family in Punjab's Patiala
234.article_body: A roof collapse of a house killed four members of a family and injured one in Punjab's Patiala, the police said. The collapse of the roof occurred due to heavy rains while the members of the family were sleeping inside the rented accommodation at Jakhal Road in Patran. The injured, identified as 15-year-old Vikas, sustained head injuries, an official said.

235.title: Karnataka to serve eggs in midday meals to tackle malnutrition
235.article_body: The Karnataka government decided to include boiled eggs, bananas and groundnut cakes in midday meals for students from class 1-8 to tackle malnutrition. Education Minister BC Nagesh said that vegetarian students will not be forced to consume eggs. Calling these the best available protein-rich food items, he said that the eggs will be boiled in the school premises.

236.title: Jammu-Srinagar national highway reopens for one-way traffic
236.article_body: The 270 km Jammu-Srinagar national highway reopened for one-way traffic on Thursday, after it was shut down due to landslides owing to heavy rainfall in Ramban district, as per officials. Nearly 1,000 vehicles stranded at different points in the district were allowed to move. Work is underway to clear the highway for two-way traffic, Ramban police added.

237.title: State-wise list of votes polled in Presidential election released
237.article_body: BJP-led NDA's candidate Droupadi Murmu won the Presidential election by securing 64.03% votes. Opposition's candidate Yashwant Sinha received 35.97% votes. The state-wise list of votes polled in the election shows Yashwant didn't receive a single vote in Andhra Pradesh, Sikkim and Nagaland. President-elect Murmu received 181 votes in Maharashtra and 287 in Uttar Pradesh.

238.title: BJP govt misusing central agencies, democracy is in danger: Gehlot
238.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot slammed the central government for misusing central agencies, like the Enforcement Directorate, and said that democracy is in danger, ahead of Congress interim president Sonia Gandhi's appearance before the agency. "Our fight is to save the nation. Today, if they (BJP) would have been in our place, they would have indulged in arson," said Gehlot.

239.title: China is now top priority for British intelligence: MI6 chief
239.article_body: China is now the top priority for UK's Secret Intelligence Service, MI6 chief Richard Moore said on Thursday. Understanding how China pursues its strategic goals is a particularly complex challenge, he added. "And there's a role for organisations like mine in helping British...policymakers to understand that, so they can navigate this...difficult relationship with the Chinese," he further said.

240.title: Ranveer Singh poses nude for Paper magazine
240.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has posed nude in an article for 'Paper' magazine. Speaking to the magazine, he said, "In some of my performances I've been damn f**king naked...That's being actually naked." "I can be naked in front of a thousand people, I don't give a shit. It's just that they get uncomfortable," Ranveer added.

241.title: Choubey appointed C'garh Panchayat & Rural Development Minister
241.article_body: Chhattisgarh government named Ravindra Choubey as the state's Panchayat and Rural Development Minister on Thursday. The 65-year-old has replaced TS Singh Deo, who resigned from the post on July 16. While resigning, he said he was unable to fulfil the targets of the department. He also claimed that funds weren't sanctioned under Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana despite his repeated requests.

242.title: Shining example of women empowerment: Patnaik on Droupadi Murmu
242.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik congratulated Droupadi Murmu on Thursday for her victory in the Presidential elections. "Her journey from a humble beginning to become the First Citizen of the country is...inspiring...Her journey is a shining example of women empowerment," the CM tweeted. "[I] congratulate the daughter of Odisha," he added. President-elect Murmu was born in a tribal family in Odisha.

243.title: Truth will prevail over 'arrogance & dictatorship': Rahul Gandhi
243.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi took a jibe at the Central government on Thursday over its unwillingness to discuss issues like inflation and misuse of agencies, asserting that "the truth will prevail over dictatorship". His attack came on the day Congress president Sonia Gandhi appeared before the Enforcement Directorate (ED) for questioning in the National Herald money laundering case.

244.title: Heatwaves predicted to return to China over next 10 days
244.article_body: Heatwaves are forecast to return to China over the next 10 days with temperatures expected to rise across the country, meteorologists warned on Thursday. This comes days after 86 cities in the country, including Shanghai, issued red alerts amid soaring temperatures. Notably, heatwaves and wildfires are being reported across several parts of the world, including the United Kingdom and Spain.

245.title: Ship spills 35,000 gallons of fuel off island in Bahamas
245.article_body: A ship spilled around 35,000 gallons of fuel into the ocean off an island in The Bahamas on Wednesday. The crew of the ship had deployed absorbent pads and containment buoys, according to a statement from Bahamas-based Sun Oil. Notably, the island of Great Exuma is famed for its white sand beaches and crystal-blue waters.

246.title: Opium worth ₹10 crore seized in Guwahati
246.article_body: Police seized opium worth ₹10 crore and arrested four persons in connection with it in Assam's Guwahati on Thursday. Officials said the 20503 Dibrugarh-New Delhi Rajdhani Express train was raided based on a tip-off. "The weight of opium is 10.11 kg and market value is approximately ₹10 crore. They were carrying the opium from Dimapur to Howrah," an official said.

247.title: US publishes list of suspected corrupt actors in Central America
247.article_body: The US State Department has released a list of 60 current and former officials suspected of corruption in Central American nations Honduras, El Salvador, Guatemala and Nicaragua. US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said these individuals contribute to irregular migration and destabilising societies. The US visas of those mentioned in the list are generally revoked.

248.title: Italy's Prez dissolves Parliament after PM Draghi's resignation
248.article_body: Italy's President Sergio Mattarella dissolved the country's Parliament on Thursday, clearing the way for an early election. "The dissolution of the parliamentary chamber is always the last choice," Mattarella said. Notably, the development comes after Italian Prime Minister Mario Draghi's resignation earlier today following the collapse of his national unity government.

249.title: Turkey denies conducting airstrikes in northern Iraq
249.article_body: Turkey on Thursday dismissed reports that its military carried out airstrikes in northern Iraq on Wednesday, killing eight tourists. Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlut Cavusoglu said Ankara was ready to cooperate with Baghdad to ascertain who carried out the "treacherous attack" in the Kurdish-run district of Zakho. Cavusoglu said Turkey's fight in Iraq is with only the Kurdistan Workers Party.

250.title: President-elect Murmu greets Union ministers outside Delhi home
250.article_body: President-elect Droupadi Murmu on Thursday greeted Union ministers, political leaders and media present outside her residence in Delhi. Union ministers Dharmendra Pradhan and Kiren Rijiju were among those who met her. Earlier, PM Narendra Modi and BJP chief JP Nadda visited Murmu's residence to congratulate her on being elected as the 15th President of India.

251.title: 'Namaste Vietnam' festival to mark 75 yrs of Indian Independence
251.article_body: The first-ever 'Namaste Vietnam' fest will be held in Ho Chi Minh City and Nha Trang from August 12-21 to mark 75 years of India's independence. The 10-day festival has been planned in accordance with India's 'Act East policy' and will also mark 50 years of diplomatic ties between the countries, official release stated. Several celebrities will attend the festival.

252.title: Iran recalls envoy to Sweden in protest over ex-official's jail sentence
252.article_body: Iran has recalled its ambassador to Sweden in protest against a jail sentence handed by Swedish court to an ex-Iranian prison official. The court said that Hamid Noury, who was sentenced to life in jail, had participated in "executions of many political prisoners" in the 1980s. However, Iran said that the verdict "is based on baseless, distorted and fabricated accusations".

253.title: Golden moment for India: BJP chief congratulates President-elect Murmu
253.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda on Thursday congratulated Droupadi Murmu on being elected as the 15th President of the country. He said this is a golden moment for India. "Murmu's elevation to the highest office of the country today shows that the BJP government is determined for the welfare of every section," Nadda said.

254.title: NCLT orders insolvency proceedings against Future Retail
254.article_body: The Mumbai bench of National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) on Wednesday allowed a consortium of lenders, led by Bank of India (BoI), to initiate insolvency proceedings against debt-laden Future Retail. The tribunal also rejected e-commerce major Amazon's objection to BoI's petition. Amazon had alleged that the petition to initiate insolvency proceedings against the Indian retailer was "malicious".

255.title: Historic moment as Prez's post will be held by tribal woman: Meghalaya CM
255.article_body: After Droupadi Murmu was elected as the President of India, Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma said, "It's a great and historic moment as the President's post will now be held by a tribal woman." "It's something that was inconceivable many years ago. I'd like to thank all who voted for our President, PM and others...who made this possible," he said.

256.title: Al Qaeda chief Ayman al-Zawahiri is alive, lives in Afghanistan: UN
256.article_body: Al Qaeda chief Ayman al-Zawahiri is alive and resides in Afghanistan where he communicates openly, a recent report by the UN has claimed. The report further stated that ties between the Taliban and Al Qaeda are still strong. Separately, the report noted that the Islamic State (IS) is using Afghanistan as a platform for its global expansion.

257.title: 5 Kanwariyas saved from drowning while bathing in Ganga in U'khand
257.article_body: Five Kanwariyas were saved from drowning while bathing in the Ganga in Uttarakhand's Haridwar on Thursday, an official said. The strong currents of the river swept them away, the official added. Jawans of the 40th battalion of the Provincial Armed Constabulary (PAC) deployed on the banks of the river saved the Kanwariyas, who were residents of Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad.

258.title: Shah congratulates Murmu, says 'she fought against odd circumstances'
258.article_body:
Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday congratulated Droupadi Murmu on being elected the President of India. He said, "[She] has reached this highest position of the country today after fighting against the odd circumstances...it shows the immense power of our democracy."
Murmu, belonging to Odisha's tribal community, was elected as India's 15th President.

259.title: How many recruitments were made by UPSC, SSC and IBPS in the last 2 years?
259.article_body: The government on Thursday stated in Rajya Sabha that during the last two years amid COVID-19 pandemic, the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC), Staff Selection Commission (SSC) and Institute of Banking Personnel Selection (IBPS) recruited 1,59,615 people. As per the data shared by the government, the UPSC recruited 8,913 people, SSC recruited 97,914 people and IBPS recruited 52,788 people.

260.title: Arjun Kapoor sells Mumbai flat bought for ₹20 crore at ₹16 crore: Report
260.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor sold his apartment in 81 Aureate building in Bandra West for ₹16 crore, as per reports. The 4,364-square-foot flat is on the 19th floor of the building. Arjun reportedly purchased the property last year for ₹20 crore. Arjun's sister, Anshula, signed the sale papers and the stamp duty paid for the registration was ₹96 lakh, reports added.

261.title: K'taka to bring policy to ensure power supply to every household: CM
261.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said the state government has decided to bring a policy to ensure power supply to every poor household in the state. Addressing a crowd at the 53rd Formation Day of Karnataka Power Corporation, Bommai said, "Electricity is one of the essential services...It's the duty of the government to provide electricity just like supply of drinking water."

262.title: Indonesian pilot dies after landing passenger plane amid health issue
262.article_body: The pilot of a passenger airplane in Indonesia suffered a health emergency after take-off on Thursday and was forced to return to the airport before being rushed to a hospital where he later died. However, the cause of the pilot's death wasn't immediately known. Citilink Indonesia said that all crew were declared fit in health checks prior to the flight.

263.title: Many nations are trying to run cricket like football: PCB chief Ramiz Raja
263.article_body: PCB Chairman Ramiz Raja said many nations are trying to run cricket like football. "They'll realise what they've done when they complete the calendar. They will realise that if your captain isn't strong, your team can't progress," he added. Ramiz further said, "I haven't interfered in the team selections, even though I can do it. It is my right."

264.title: WestBridge Capital raises $1.5 bn to invest in Indian firms: Report
264.article_body: Investment fund WestBridge Capital has raised $1.5 billion to invest in Indian companies, as per reports. WestBridge Capital has backed unicorns such as LEAD and Vedantu, and this is its largest-ever fund for India-focused companies. WestBridge Capital's total portfolio includes as many as 132 companies, and its assets under management in India have reportedly crossed $10 billion.

265.title: SC halts hearing in Gyanvapi mosque case till Varanasi court verdict
265.article_body: Supreme Court has decided to halt the hearing of appeal filed by Gyanvapi mosque's management committee till Varanasi court announces its verdict on the committee's plea questioning the maintainability of the suit filed by Hindu plaintiffs. It adjourned the hearing to October. It also refused to entertain petitions seeking the right to worship the alleged 'Shivling' found at the site.

266.title: Hang killers of Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal: LS member
266.article_body: Speaking in the Parliament, Lok Sabha member Arjun Lal Meena called for the hanging of the killers of Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal. He said capital punishment would prove to be a deterrent for those who plan to destabilise peace in Udaipur. He also called for a ban on activities of Dawat-e-Islami, a Pakistan-based organisation allegedly linked to the incident.

267.title: Fast food chain Burger Singh raises ₹30 cr in Series A round
267.article_body: Homegrown fast food chain Burger Singh has raised ₹30 crore in its Series A funding round. The round was led by Negen Capital and saw participation from LetsVenture, Mumbai Angels, Old World Hospitality and singer Jasleen Royal, along with existing investors. The company aims to use the funds to launch 120 food court outlets in the current fiscal.

268.title: Ex-RJD MLA Anant Singh sentenced to 10 yrs in jail in another arms case
268.article_body: Former RJD MLA Anant Singh was on Thursday sentenced to 10 years of rigorous imprisonment in another case relating to recovery of arms and explosives from his residence. He was awarded the same quantum of sentence by the court in June in a 2019 case relating to the recovery of an AK-47 rifle, ammunition and grenades from his Mokama residence.

269.title: Unmarried woman cannot be denied choice to abort: Supreme Court
269.article_body: The Supreme Court passed an interim order allowing an unmarried woman to terminate her 24-week pregnancy, provided her life is not endangered. Justice DY Chandrachud noted that the 2021 amendment in Medical Termination of Pregnancy Act used the term 'partner' instead of husband. Parliamentary intent is not to confine the benefits to situations arising out of marriages, the bench observed.

270.title: UP ministers to hold road shows in over 20 countries ahead of investors' meet
270.article_body: Uttar Pradesh ministers will be going on foreign tours to showcase the state as an 'investment hub' ahead of the Global Investor Summit, 2023 in the state. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has set a target of ₹10 lakh crore in investments in the summit. The event will have one day dedicated to the Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises sector.

271.title: Gutkha worth ₹17.50 lakh seized from 2 Navi Mumbai houses, one held
271.article_body: Gutkha, pan masala and tobacco products worth ₹17.50 lakh were seized after raids were conducted at two houses in Navi Mumbai's Kopar Khairane and Ghansoli. Police said they arrested 37-year-old Manoj Kumar Narendra Khanda, who stocked the banned products. During the raid, 32 sacks of pan masala, 15 sacks of tobacco and 11 sacks of scented pan masala were found.

272.title: Edtech platform Creative Galileo raises $7.5 mn in Series A round
272.article_body: Early learning edtech platform Creative Galileo has raised $7.5 million in its Series A funding round. The round was led by Kalaari Capital, Affirma Capital, East Ventures, Valiant Employee Investment Fund, and angel investors. Founded in July 2020 by Prerna A Jhunjhunwala and Nikhil Naik, the startup claims to have over 7 million downloads. It has 7,00,000 monthly active users.

273.title: 151 grams of gold worth ₹7.82 lakh seized at Jaipur airport
273.article_body: The Customs officials seized 151 grams of gold worth ₹7.82 lakh from a passenger who arrived at Jaipur International Airport from Dubai, an official said on Thursday. "The smuggled gold of 99.50 purity...has been seized under the provisions of the Customs Act, 1962," the official said. A gold bangle and a ring were found concealed in clothes, the official added.

274.title: US-based Biliti Electric unveils hydrogen fuel cell-powered 3-wheeler
274.article_body: E-mobility company Biliti Electric has unveiled what it claims to be the world's first hydrogen fuel cell-powered electric three-wheeler vehicle. Biliti claimed the vehicle, named FastMile, has a refueling time of less than three minutes and offers a range of up to 209 kilometres. FastMile has a payload capacity of 680 kilograms and has been tested for over 9,656 kilometres.

275.title: UP minister Dinesh Khatik meets CM after resigning, says 'will continue in office'
275.article_body: A day after resigning as the Uttar Pradesh Minister of State for Jal Shakti, Dinesh Khatik on Thursday met CM Yogi Adityanath and said he'll continue in the post. "Whatever my issues were, I've put them before the CM. Action will be taken," he said. Khatik had alleged that he was being ignored by officials as he is a Dalit.

276.title: Ukrainian First Lady appeals for more weapons to US lawmakers
276.article_body: Ukraine's First Lady Olena Zelenska has addressed US lawmakers, appealing for more western weapons, particularly air defence systems, in its war against Russia. The request came as Russia indicated plans to take broader areas in eastern Ukraine. Till date, the US and NATO have sent HIMARS rocket launchers, heavy artillery, armor, drones, air defence systems and warplanes to Ukraine.

277.title: 4 killed as under-construction building's wall falls in Bengaluru
277.article_body: Four persons were killed and four others sustained injuries when the wall of an under-construction building fell on them in Bengaluru on early Thursday morning. The deceased were identified as construction labourers from Bihar, who were sleeping at their worksite on Soukya Road in Hosakote area at the time of the accident. The injured were rushed to a nearby hospital.

278.title: Minister plays drums after Droupadi Murmu becomes President of India
278.article_body: Union Minister Meenakashi Lekhi played drums after NDA candidate Droupadi Murmu became the President of India on Thursday. Murmu has become India's first tribal woman President. She won against Opposition nominee Yashwant Sinha by a huge margin. PM Narendra Modi congratulated Murmu and said, "Her record victory augurs well for our democracy."

279.title: US Prez Biden unveils measures to tackle climate change
279.article_body: US President Joe Biden has unveiled a set of executive measures to tackle climate change, calling it "literally an existential threat to our nation". The move comes as parts of the US experience extremely high temperatures. According to the measures, states will be provided $2.3 billion to "increase resilience to heat waves, drought, wildfires, flood, hurricanes, and other hazards".

280.title: Govt to introduce new Emigration Bill for safe & legal migrations
280.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs will introduce a new Emigration Bill to promote "safe and legal" migration and prevent illegal recruitment agencies from cheating people, the Centre told Rajya Sabha on Thursday. "[The] new...bill...will take into account a lot of digital tracking," EAM S Jaishankar said. Centre is also working with state governments to spread awareness on safe emigration.

281.title: PM Modi visits Droupadi Murmu's residence to congratulate her on becoming President
281.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited Droupadi Murmu's residence to congratulate her on being elected as the 15th President of India. A video has been shared online showing PM Modi greeting her with a bouquet. BJP National President JP Nadda was also present. Droupadi Murmu is the second woman to be elected as India's President.

282.title: KL Rahul tests positive for COVID-19 ahead of India-West Indies series
282.article_body: India batter KL Rahul has tested positive for COVID-19, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said. Rahul was included in India's squad for the T20I series against West Indies subject to fitness. Rahul last played an international match in February this year. He hasn't played professional cricket since IPL 2022 due to a groin injury. He had undergone groin operation in June.

283.title: India scripts history: PM as he congratulates Droupadi Murmu on being elected President
283.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while congratulating Droupadi Murmu on being elected President of India, tweeted, "India scripts history." "A daughter of India hailing from a tribal community born in a remote part of eastern India has been elected our President!" he added. "Her record victory augurs well for our democracy," the PM wrote.

284.title: 15,000 Russians troops killed fighting in Ukraine, says CIA chief
284.article_body: CIA chief William Burns on Wednesday said the US estimates that around 15,000 Russian troops have been killed and 45,000 others have been injured in the war in Ukraine. "The Ukrainians have suffered as well - probably a little less than that. But, you know, significant casualties," he added. Currently, Russian forces occupy around a fifth of the country.

285.title: Facebook's main feed to be revamped to prioritise content discovery: Meta
285.article_body: Meta on Thursday said it was revamping Facebook's main feed to prioritise "discovery" of new content, instead of posts and accounts users follow. 'Home', Facebook's main news feed tab, will start heavily featuring popular posts from accounts that users don't follow, including reels and stories. Facebook is investing in artificial intelligence to serve recommended content, Meta said.

286.title: We will continue to stand by the people of Sri Lanka: MEA
286.article_body: Amid the severe economic crisis in Sri Lanka, a spokesperson for the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Thursday said, "We will continue to stand by the people of Sri Lanka." The comment came a day after the Sri Lankan Parliament elected Ranil Wickremesinghe as the country's President. India has provided aid, including medicines and fuel supplies, to Sri Lanka.

287.title: Man hides $13,000 inside his turban, caught at Kolkata airport
287.article_body: Customs officials at Kolkata airport on Tuesday arrested three people and recovered $42,000 from them. One of them was carrying $13,000 by hiding currency notes in the folds of his turban. Around $29,000 were kept on the outer side of two different bags by removing the stitching and sewing it back with the money inside.

288.title: Yashwant Sinha pens note after losing Presidential election, quotes Bhagavad Gita
288.article_body: Yashwant Sinha tweeted a note after losing Presidential election to Droupadi Murmu. "I accepted...offer of Opposition parties solely guided by...philosophy of Karma Yoga preached by Lord Krishna in...Bhagavad Gita- 'Do your duty without expectation of fruits thereof'," he wrote. He congratulated Murmu, saying, "India hopes...she functions as...Custodian of the Constitution without fear or favour."

289.title: US President Joe Biden tests positive for COVID-19
289.article_body: US President Joe Biden has tested positive for COVID-19, the White House said on Thursday. The White House added that he is "fully vaccinated and twice boosted and experiencing very mild symptoms". He will isolate at the White House and "will continue to carry out all of his duties fully during that time," the press release stated.

290.title: Govt spent ₹911 crore on advertisements over last 3 yrs: Thakur
290.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Thursday informed the Rajya Sabha that the Centre had spent ₹911.17 crore on advertisements in newspapers, television channels and web portals in the past three years. Advertisements on newspapers accounted for over ₹690 crore of the total amount, according to Thakur. TV advertisements cost the government nearly 200 crore, Thakur said.

291.title: 'Death pool' that kills anything that swims into it discovered at the bottom of Red Sea
291.article_body: Scientists from University of Miami have discovered a long brine pool at the bottom of Red Sea that's lethal to most creatures. Rare brine pools in Red Sea are extremely salty. They cannot sustain marine life forms because they are devoid of oxygen. The scientists made the discovery at a depth of 1,770 metre using a remotely operated underwater vehicle.

292.title: Air India Dubai-Cochin flight diverted to Mumbai after 'low pressure' in cabin
292.article_body: A Dubai-Cochin Air India flight was diverted to Mumbai after an incident of low pressure was reported in the cabin, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) said. The flight landed safely in Mumbai, the DGCA added. "Two senior officers of O/o DAS WR have been assigned the task to carry out a preliminary investigation," the DGCA further stated.

293.title: Droupadi Murmu set to become President of India as she crosses halfway mark
293.article_body: Droupadi Murmu is set to become the 15th President of India after crossing the 50% mark of total valid votes at the end of third round of counting. Hailing from Odisha's Mayurbhanj, she has served as the Governor of Jharkhand from 2015 to 2021. She's contesting against Opposition's candidate Yashwant Sinha. Voting for the post took place on July 18.

294.title: Russia's war on Ukraine making China rethink on Taiwan: CIA chief
294.article_body: China is basing Russian military offensive in Ukraine to determine when and how, and not whether, to invade Taiwan, CIA chief Bill Burns has said. Burns added that China is "unsettled" when looking at Russia-Ukraine war, calling it "strategic failure" for Russian President Vladimir Putin. Notably, China has warned US of consequences if US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visits Taiwan.

295.title: Kejriwal ignores LG's advice, says 'will go ahead' with Singapore visit
295.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal wrote a letter to Delhi LG VK Saxena, saying he'll "go ahead" and attend World Cities Summit in Singapore. Earlier, Saxena advised Kejriwal to not attend the summit, saying prima facie it's meant for Mayors. "Then the Prime Minister wouldn't be able to go anywhere...[In] most of his visits, he...discusses subjects [outside his jurisdiction]," Kejriwal said.

296.title: Last rites of Haryana DSP killed amid mining raid performed in Hisar
296.article_body: The last rites of Haryana DSP Surender Singh, who was run over by a truck during a mining raid in Nuh, were performed with full state honours at his native village in Hisar on Thursday. Deputy Speaker Ranbir Gangwa, Congress MLA Kuldeep Bishnoi and DGP PK Agrawal were present there. He is survived by his wife and two children.

297.title: Parts of ₹14,850-crore Bundelkhand Expressway cave in within 5 days of inauguration
297.article_body: Pictures have surfaced online showing parts of Bundelkhand Expressway caving in. Prime Minister Narendra Modi had inaugurated the expressway in Uttar Pradesh on July 16. The expressway has been constructed at a cost of ₹14,850 crore. The expressway passes through seven districts of Uttar Pradesh, namely Chitrakoot, Banda, Mahoba, Hamirpur, Jalaun, Auraiya and Etawah.

298.title: Govt’s aim is 'character assassination': Pilot on Sonia's ED questioning
298.article_body: Criticising the Centre over Congress chief Sonia Gandhi's questioning by the ED, party leader Sachin Pilot on Thursday said that the BJP government's sole aim is to indulge in the "character assassination" of people. "This questioning has been initiated to damage the morale of the leadership, target the Opposition and trample upon the voice of the Opposition," he said.

299.title: No COVID-19 restrictions during Ganesh Chaturthi, Dahi Handi, Muharram: Maha CM
299.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde said all COVID-related restrictions during Ganesh Chaturthi, Dahi Handi and Muharram have been lifted in the state. There are no restrictions on the height of Ganesh's idols, Shinde said. "Our festival should be celebrated without any problems...A single window permission system will be there. All the concession will be given," he added.

300.title: European Central Bank raises interest rates for first time in 11 years
300.article_body: The European Central Bank (ECB) on Thursday raised interest rates for the first time in more than 11 years. The ECB raised its key interest rate by 0.5 percentage points to 0.0%. The ECB said that the increase is necessary to limit the pressure on prices over the next two years. It also increased its main refinancing rate to 0.50%.

301.title: Man stabs, pushes brother off 4th floor over property dispute in B'luru
301.article_body: A 37-year-old man allegedly killed his younger brother by stabbing him and pushing him from the fourth floor of a building over a property dispute in Bengaluru. According to reports, an argument broke out between the two brothers when the accused proposed the sale of one of two buildings owned by their father to clear loans.

302.title: Demanding patch-up with wife, drunk man climbs mobile tower in Maha
302.article_body: A man, allegedly under the influence of alcohol, climbed atop a 100-foot mobile phone tower in Maharashtra, seeking his wife's return from her parent's place, a police official said on Thursday. The man came down only after an assurance from villagers, fire brigade and police personnel that they would strive to solve the domestic dispute, he added.

303.title: Summit is for Mayors: Delhi LG as he denies CM's plea for Singapore visit
303.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor (LG) VK Saxena has refused to approve CM Arvind Kejriwal's proposal regarding visiting Singapore to attend the World Cities Summit. The LG advised Kejriwal to not attend the summit since it is a conference of Mayors and won't be befitting for a CM to attend it, ANI reported. The summit is set to commence on July 31.

304.title: Solar panels costing ₹88 cr to be installed on ORR cycling track in Hyd
304.article_body: Solar panels along the 21-km cycling track on outer ring road (ORR) will be installed by Hyderabad Growth Corridor Limited (HGCL), a wing of Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA), at a cost of ₹88.12 crore. "The solar panels...would generate about 7 MV to 9 MV power per year," an official said. The HGCL has reportedly invited tenders for the project.

305.title: Bengaluru records highest daily rainfall in July in 14 years
305.article_body: After recording the wettest June in 10 years, Bengaluru has seen the highest daily rainfall in July in 14 years after recording 82.6 mm of rainfall on July 20, IMD data said. According to the Karnataka State Natural Disaster Monitoring Centre, Sampangi Rama Nagar received the highest rainfall of 79.5 mm in 24 hours till 8:30 am on Thursday.

306.title: 2 dozen cars damaged during attack in housing society in Gurugram
306.article_body: Around 15 men damaged over two dozen cars at a housing society in Gurugram's Sector 70A, the police said on Wednesday. The assailants also assaulted the housing society's security guards, the police added. Sources have said that the attack is a result of a personal enmity with a resident of the society.

307.title: Pune RTO commences drive against illegal bike taxi services
307.article_body: Pune Regional Transport Office on Monday commenced drive against illegally operating app-based auto rickshaw services and bike taxis. "We are strictly checking the auto-rickshaws and two-wheelers which are running without authorised meters and with the mobile app-based system," RTO official Ajit Shinde said. "Earlier, we had seized more than 250 illegal bikes. The same will be done now," he added.

308.title: If Sonia doesn't call off protests, we won't consider her Indian: Uma
308.article_body: Reacting to protests over Enforcement Directorate's summons to Congress' Sonia Gandhi in National Herald case, BJP's Uma Bharti said it'll be determined if Gandhi's an Indian citizen if she stops the protests. "Otherwise we won't...forget that she's of Italian origin and doesn't respect Indian law," Bharti tweeted. Seventy-five Congress MPs were detained today for protesting over Gandhi's summons.

309.title: HC refuses to entertain PIL seeking clean milk for Delhi citizens
309.article_body: The Delhi HC on Thursday refused to entertain a PIL to "advise" the Lieutenant Governor of Delhi and the Commissioner of city police to ensure a supply of clean and hygienic milk. In the petition, the petitioner said that the "neglected, abandoned and pathetic condition of the cattle" is affecting the health of Delhi citizens.

310.title: Trinamool Congress to abstain from voting in Vice Presidential election
310.article_body: The Trinamool Congress headed by West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee will abstain from voting in the upcoming Vice Presidential poll, party MP Abhishek Banerjee said on Thursday. He said the party will not support NDA candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar, who was the Governor of West Bengal. The Opposition has fielded Margaret Alva in the election.

311.title: No additional amount to be charged for issuing boarding passes at airport counters
311.article_body: Ministry of Civil Aviation on Thursday said it has come to its notice that airlines are charging additional amount for issuing boarding passes from the passengers seeking check-in at airport counters. "Airlines are advised not to charge any additional amount...as the same cannot be considered within the 'tariff' as provided under Rule 135 of the Aircraft Rules, 1937," it said.

312.title: Female users in India leaving Facebook over privacy fear: Meta study
312.article_body: Female Facebook users in India are leaving the platform over concerns about their safety and privacy, said a study conducted by Facebook-parent Meta which was reviewed by Reuters. "Concerns about content safety and unwanted contact impede women's Facebook use," the study added. Other obstacles faced by Facebook include nudity content, perceived complexity of its app design and literacy barriers.

313.title: Break BJP's prison, bring people's government in 2024: WB CM Mamata
313.article_body: While addressing a rally in Kolkata, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday urged the people to break BJP's prison and elect a people's government in the 2024 elections. "What will the people eat when the BJP is implementing GST on everything, even puffed rice and milk powder. How will the poor survive in this country?" she said.

314.title: OYO marketing chief Rohit Kapoor likely to join Swiggy: Report
314.article_body: Hotel aggregation platform OYO's Global Chief Marketing Officer, Rohit Kapoor, has reportedly quit and will join Swiggy as its first Chief Executive Officer of food delivery business, according to reports. Rohit Kapoor took on his current role in April 2022, after Ankit Gupta was elevated as CEO of Softbank-backed OYO. He will report to Swiggy founder and CEO Sriharsha Majety.

315.title: 94 YouTube channels, 19 social media accounts blocked in 2021-22: Govt
315.article_body: Information and Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur on Thursday said that in 2021-22, the government blocked 94 YouTube channels, 19 social media accounts and 747 URLs engaged in anti-India activities. Government has taken strict measures to stop people from creating propaganda, Thakur said. "The government also issues advisory...to the media to adhere to the laid down Codes," he added.

316.title: Nykaa, Estee Lauder launch beauty incubator with ₹4-crore pool
316.article_body: Beauty and personal care retailer Nykaa has launched an incubator programme, Beauty&You India, in partnership with American beauty brand Estee Lauder with a prize pool of ₹4 crore. The new incubator programme allows beauty companies to showcase their brand and have an opportunity for acquisition. Apart from the prize money, the winners will also get mentorship from industry experts.

317.title: 7 get jail term for harassing women during Bonalu festival in Hyd
317.article_body: A local court on Wednesday sentenced seven persons to undergo jail term for harassing women during Bonalu festivities, Hyderabad Police tweeted. The accused were taking photographs of women visiting the temple on the occasion of the festival and were caught red-handed by the She Teams, police stated. The accused were sentenced to prison ranging from two days to ten days.

318.title: ODI cricket is dying, I think it should be scrapped: Wasim Akram
318.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Wasim Akram has said that ODI cricket is dying, adding that administrators should consider scrapping the 50-over format. Akram added, "It's quite tiring for a player to play one-day cricket. After T20, one-day cricket seems it is going for days. So players are focussing on more shorter format. And longer format obviously [with] Test cricket."

319.title: 2 killed as their vehicle rams into container truck in UP's Basti
319.article_body:
Two people were killed when the vehicle they were travelling in rammed into a container truck after it was hit by another truck from behind in Uttar Pradesh's Basti, police said on Thursday.
The deceased have been identified as 45-year-old Manjay Yadav and 35-year-old Raju. The accident affected the movement of traffic on the highway for sometime, police added.

320.title: Droupadi Murmu leads by 812 votes after 2nd round of counting in Presidential poll
320.article_body: BJP-led NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu is leading by a margin of 812 votes after the second round of counting in the Presidential poll. Murmu has received 1,349 votes so far, valued at 4,83,299, Rajya Sabha Secretary General PC Mody said. Meanwhile, Opposition's candidate Yashwant Sinha has got 537 votes, valued at 1,89,876, he added.

321.title: 300 units of free electricity in Gujarat if AAP wins: Kejriwal
321.article_body: In the run up to Gujarat Assembly elections, Aam Aadmi Party national convener Arvind Kejriwal has promised free electricity up to 300 units per month if elected. Speaking at a town hall meeting in Surat, Kejriwal said AAP will waive off pending power bills till December 31, 2021. This will be implemented within three months of being elected, he said.

322.title: Samajwadi Party intimidates Muslims for votes: SBSP chief
322.article_body: Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party (SBSP) chief Om Prakash Rajbhar on Thursday criticised his alliance partner Samajwadi Party over its treatment of Muslims. "The Samajwadi Party (SP) gets votes of Muslims by intimidating them but when the time comes to give the Muslim community their rights, the party turns its back on them," Om Prakash Rajbhar said.

323.title: UK Queen's jewels on show at Buckingham Palace to mark 70-yr reign
323.article_body: Personal jewels of UK's Queen Elizabeth II will be put on display at Buckingham Palace from Friday for Platinum Jubilee celebrations. Tiaras, earrings and necklaces form part of "The Queen’s Accession" exhibition, which marks her seven decades on the throne. Queen Elizabeth II is the second-longest reigning monarch in the world after France's Louis XIV who reigned for 72 years.

324.title: Mahindra shares edited pic of footwear outside UK PM's residence as Sunak enters top 2
324.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share an edited viral picture of footwear outside UK PM's residence, 10 Downing Street. "Brit-Indian humour has gone into overdrive with Shri [Rishi] Sunak in the final shortlist of two [in UK PM race]. Of course the real test lies ahead with the larger mass of party faithful," he wrote.

325.title: Woman gives birth on road in UP after accident, dies minutes later
325.article_body: A woman gave birth to her child on a road minutes before her death because of a road accident in UP, police said on Thursday. The deceased, along with her husband, was travelling on their motorcycle when a truck rammed into the two-wheeler near Bartara village, ASP (city) Mukesh Chandra Mishra said.

326.title: Good job: Moosewala's father after gangsters killed in police encounter
326.article_body: Singer Sidhu Moosewala's father, Balkaur Singh, visited Amritsar hospital to identify the two gangsters who were killed in an encounter with Punjab Police on Wednesday. Gangsters Jagroop Singh Roopa and Manpreet Singh were involved in Moosewala's murder. "It's a good job done by Punjab Police and such actions should continue...This is just a start," Balkaur said after identifying their bodies.

327.title: Bengaluru civic body to file FIRs against illegal banners
327.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike will lodge an FIR by the end of this week against persons installing illegal banners. Speaking on hundreds of political banners installed recently, BBMP chief Tushar Giri Nath said, "We have warned...several times...FIR will be lodged against the violators." As per a High Court order, no banners can be put up in BBMP limits.

328.title: Everything’s fine with Putin: Kremlin rejects rumours on his health
328.article_body: The Kremlin on Thursday said that "everything is fine" with Russian President Vladimir Putin's health. "Ukrainian information specialists and American and British ones have been throwing out various fakes [rumours] about the state of the President's health," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. A video showing Putin limping as he arrived in Iran on Tuesday has surfaced on social media.

329.title: Control room set up to facilitate Kanwar Yatra in GB Nagar: Police
329.article_body: A special control room has been set up to facilitate movement of Kanwariyas through the Gautam Buddha Nagar district, police officials said on Wednesday. The control centre has been set up at the Chilla border in Noida, they added. Separately, movement of heavy vehicles has also been restricted on the routes used by Kanwariyas, a senior police official said.

330.title: Congress workers burn car near B'luru ED office during protest
330.article_body: Congress workers protesting against Enforcement Directorate (ED) summons to party chief Sonia Gandhi on Thursday burnt a car near the agency's Bengaluru office. Congress workers are protesting across the country against ED questioning Sonia in the National Herald case. She left the ED office in Delhi after being questioned for nearly two hours on Thursday.

331.title: 2 men arrested for stealing bikes & selling them online in Kalyan
331.article_body: Thane Police has arrested two men for motor vehicle theft. The accused, Mohammed Shaikh and Abubakar Shaikh, used to search for bikes on OLX, ask the seller for documents and details and then steal a similar bike. They then created fake documents based on documents taken from the seller, change the stolen bike's number plate and sell it online.

332.title: Woman who accused Rajasthan minister's son of rape moves Delhi HC
332.article_body: A woman who accused Rajasthan Minister Mahesh Joshi's son of raping her multiple times moved Delhi HC on Thursday seeking cancellation of anticipatory bail granted to the man by trial court. The woman in her petition stated that the accused, Rohit, has been threatening her to withdraw her complaint since being out on bail. She filed the complaint in May.

333.title: 2 Kanwar Yatris killed, 3 injured in accident on Delhi-Haridwar highway
333.article_body: Two Kanwar Yatris died and three were injured in a head-on collision between two scooters on the Delhi-Haridwar highway in Uttarakhand on Wednesday night, police said. Due to the impact of the collision, the victims were flung into the air and landed several feet away, an official said. The deceased have been identified as Rahul and Shyam Thakur.

334.title: World 100m champion Kerley out of world 4x100m relay with injury
334.article_body: Newly-crowned 100m champion Fred Kerley has been ruled out of the US team for the 4x100m relay at the World Championships in Oregon with a "slight injury to his quadriceps". Kerley suffered the injury in the 200m semi-finals, finishing sixth in 20.68 seconds. Kerley had said he cramped up in the later stages of the 200m.

335.title: Bihar electrician dies while fixing transformer as someone switches on power
335.article_body: An electrician, who had climbed a transformer to repair a technical glitch, was reportedly burnt alive at a village in Bihar's Nalanda district after someone switched on the power supply. "The technician went on the transformer after he cross-checked with the power supply station," a villager said. "It looks like someone deliberately switched on the power supply," he added.

336.title: Naomi Osaka parts ways with coach Wim Fissette
336.article_body: Former world number one Naomi Osaka has parted ways with her coach Wim Fissette. Osaka won two of her four Grand Slam titles, the US Open in 2020 and the Australian Open in 2021, under Fissette's guidance. "It has been a privilege to coach Naomi since 2019 and see her grow into the champion she has become," said Fissette.

337.title: Azam is Pak's captain cool, should lead us until retirement: Miandad
337.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Javed Miandad said Babar Azam is Pakistan's "captain cool", adding that he should lead the national team until he retires from cricket. "[He is] our number one captain...He leads from the front," stated Miandad. "The most important thing is he is performing brilliantly himself," he said. Former India captain MS Dhoni is known as 'captain cool'.

338.title: Myanmar's economy remains fragile amid civil strife: World Bank
338.article_body: Myanmar's economy remains fragile amid civil strife in the country, the World Bank and other experts said on Thursday. "Inequality is estimated to have worsened, with those already poor falling into deeper destitution," the World Bank claimed. Myanmar is one of several countries in Asia whose economies are imperilled by soaring prices and weaker currencies, according to a report.

339.title: Aamir hosts Gujarati dinner for 'Avengers: Endgame' directors Russo brothers, pic viral
339.article_body: Aamir Khan hosted a Gujarati dinner for Anthony and Joe Russo, the directors of 'Avengers: Endgame', who are in India for the promotional tour of 'The Gray Man'. They were also joined by the film's actor Dhanush and Aamir's ex-wife Kiran Rao. Aamir reportedly also flew down chefs specialising in Gujarati delicacies for the dinner.

340.title: I will never sing with him: Priyanka Chopra on husband Nick Jonas
340.article_body: Actress-singer Priyanka Chopra said she will "never sing" with husband and singer Nick Jonas. "I don't have the audacity to collaborate with him...Whenever I sing in the car, like when my jam is on...then he'll just look at me like that, I just get quiet," Priyanka had earlier stated. Priyanka and Nick got married in 2018.

341.title: Matter of pride for tribals if she becomes next Prez: Murmu's brother
341.article_body: NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu's brother Tarinisen Tudu on Thursday said that it will be a matter of pride for the tribal community, Odisha and the country if she becomes the next President of India. The counting of votes began on Thursday, with Murmu bagging 540 votes after the first round. Opposition candidate Yashwant Sinha managed 208 votes.

342.title: Karti Chidambaram writes to Serious Fraud Investigation Office to review Byju's finances
342.article_body: Congress MP Karti Chidambaram has written to Serious Fraud Investigation Office to investigate finances of Byju's. Chidambaram stated Byju's violated law by missing the legal deadline to file the Cost Audit Report for FY 2020-21. "Byju's proposes to...acquire Nasdaq-listed company 2U for $2.4 billion, while parallelly firing employees...it becomes pertinent to review [its] finances," he wrote.

343.title: Govt releases pic of 1st stamp of independent India
343.article_body: The government on Thursday released a picture of the first stamp of independent India. "The 1st Stamp of Independent India was issued on November 21, 1947 and was valued at three & a half annas," it tweeted with the picture. The picture was released under 'Moments With Tiranga' campaign.

344.title: Big question mark: Kartik on rumours about his cameo in Ranbir's film
344.article_body: Reacting to the rumours that he will be making a cameo in Luv Ranjan's upcoming film, actor Kartik Aaryan has said, "It's a big question mark." The film features actor Ranbir Kapoor and actress Shraddha Kapoor. Speaking about Luv, Kartik said, "He has been my lucky charm. Our journey has been great. I can't say much about the film."

345.title: Autonomous vehicle with detachable steering wheel unveiled by China's Baidu
345.article_body: China's search engine giant Baidu on Thursday unveiled its new autonomous vehicle (AV) with a detachable steering wheel, with plans to put it to use for its robotaxi service in China next year. The new AV won't need human intervention and will have eight lidars and 12 cameras alongside it. The AV's price will also drop to about 2,50,000 yuan.

346.title: Shiv Sena leader backing Uddhav Thackeray attacked in Maha, 2 held
346.article_body: Police on Thursday arrested two people in connection with the attack on a worker of the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena in Maharashtra, an official said. Harshawardhan Palande, Deputy Chief of the Sena's Kalyan city unit, was attacked by four to five men with sticks and rods on Wednesday, a police official said.

347.title: BJP is blinded by their desire for revenge: Baghel on Sonia's ED questioning
347.article_body: As Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi appeared before ED on Thursday, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said the BJP is "blinded by their desire for revenge". "This is the same woman who was married to [former] PM Rajiv Gandhi," Baghel added. "Sonia Gandhi has not been well, of late, and yet the BJP is after her," he stated.

348.title: School bus with 21 kids catches fire in Delhi, no casualties; video surfaces
348.article_body: A bus carrying 21 children from the Bal Bharti Public School caught fire in the middle of a road in Delhi's Rohini on Thursday. No one was injured in the incident due to quick action by the driver, police said. A video shows flames engulfing the bus, rising several feet above it. Three cars near the bus were also burnt.
