349.title: Former beauty queen arrested for stealing wine worth $1.5 million in Spain
349.article_body: A 28-year-old former beauty queen from Mexico has been arrested for stealing wine from a Spanish restaurant. Priscila Lara Guevara, along with a Romanian-Dutch man, stole 45 vintage bottles worth $1.5 million, The Telegraph said in its report quoting the Spanish media. Guevara and the man were caught this week crossing into Croatia from Montenegro.

350.title: Told Disha 'You need to take yourself more seriously' after Malang: Mohit
350.article_body: Talking about Disha Patani, filmmaker Mohit Suri said, "When I watched the climax of 'Malang' with the audience, I...messaged her...'You need to take yourself more seriously. You're not just a pretty face'." He added very few people take it as a compliment and she understood what he was trying to say. "She should...take herself...seriously as an actor," he concluded.

351.title: Doors of Matoshree open for those who want to return: Aaditya to Shinde camp
351.article_body: Shiv Sena MLA Aaditya Thackeray on Thursday said that real Shiv Sainiks are still with the party led by Uddhav Thackeray. Referring to MLAs who joined Eknath Shinde-led government, he added that the doors of Matoshree are going to remain open for those who want to return. The ones we trusted and offered ministerial posts, backstabbed us, he further said.

352.title: Wrong to summon 2 members of same family again & again: Cong leader
352.article_body: As Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi appeared before ED in connection with the National Herald case on Thursday, party leader Ghulam Nabi Azad said it is wrong to summon two members of the same family over and over again, that too in connection with the same case. The agency earlier questioned Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in connection with the case.

353.title: It's duragrah not satyagrah: BJP MP Prasad on Congress' protests
353.article_body: Commenting on the protests held by Congress over Sonia Gandhi's appearance before the Enforcement Directorate (ED), BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad said, "This is not satyagrah but duragrah against the country, its laws and its agencies." "This is also a duragrah for protecting the family which has pocketed the party's assets worth thousands of crores of rupees," the MP added.

354.title: 26-yr-old man stealing bikes on pretext of trial rides held in Mumbai
354.article_body: A 26-year-old man from Hyderabad, Zubair Irfan Sayyed, was arrested in Mumbai for stealing multiple luxury bikes from people across the city on the pretext of trial rides. "In May, Sayyed absconded with a Charkop resident's Trump bike," a police official said. Two expensive bikes, which are worth about ₹15 lakh, were also recovered from the accused, police added.

355.title: 42-year-old man arrested for cheating woman of ₹2.30 lakh in Thane
355.article_body: A 42-year-old man, Sagar Raut, was arrested from Thane for allegedly cheating a woman of ₹2.30 lakh after befriending her on Facebook, police said on Wednesday. Gaining the woman's confidence, Raut asked her to invest money in a financial scheme. After taking ₹2.30 lakh, he allegedly assured her that he will pay her ₹20,000 per month as return on investment.

356.title: 3 more die in Assam from Japanese Encephalitis, death toll reaches 35
356.article_body: At least three more persons were killed in Assam in the last 24 hours from Japanese Encephalitis, taking the death toll so far to 35, according to the National Health Mission (NHM), Assam. A total of 24 new cases were reported during the period. As many as 226 cases of Japanese Encephalitis have been detected in July so far.

357.title: TMC will win seats outside WB in 2024 LS polls: Abhishek Banerjee
357.article_body: TMC National General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee on Thursday asserted that the party will continue with its expansion plans and will win seats outside West Bengal in 2024 Lok Sabha elections. He further said that tickets for next year's panchayat elections will be distributed on the basis of "merit and not recommendations". Banerjee was addressing workers at the Martyrs' Day rally.

358.title: BJP will be defeated in 2024 Lok Sabha polls: WB CM Mamata Banerjee
358.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said the BJP will be "swept away from power" at the Centre in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. Terming BJP government as "anti-people", Banerjee said, "BJP will not get a single-party majority, and once that happens, others will unite to form the next government." "They will be defeated," she added.

359.title: 3 Indians carrying pistols held by Pak authorities at Wagah border
359.article_body: Pakistani authorities have arrested three Indians who were returning from Pakistan via the Wagah-Attari border after they were found carrying pistols with them. The persons, who belong to the same family and hail from UP's Shamli district, were detained by Pakistani customs on Wednesday. They were on a visit to Pakistan to attend a family function there, officials said.

360.title: 5 killed due to lightning in Bihar, CM announces ₹4 lakh ex-gratia
360.article_body: Five people were killed after being struck by lightning in Bihar. CM Nitish Kumar on Wednesday expressed condolences over the deaths and announced an ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh to the family members of each of the deceased. "Stay at home in bad weather," the CM tweeted. The deaths were reported in the districts of Siwan, Samastipur, Gaya, Khagaria and Saran.

361.title: Salaries of top Hollywood stars released; Tom Cruise earns most with $100 million
361.article_body: Tom Cruise has become Hollywood's highest earning actor, after he earned more than $100 million for 'Top Gun: Maverick', as per Variety. Will Smith came second with $35 million for his upcoming film 'Emancipation', followed by Leonardo DiCaprio and Brad Pitt, at $30 million each, for 'Killers of the Flower Moon' and an upcoming untitled Formula 1 drama, respectively.

362.title: Lightning kills 14 in a day in UP, CM Yogi announces ₹4 lakh assistance
362.article_body: Lightning-related incidents killed 14 persons and injured 16 others on Wednesday in Uttar Pradesh. CM Yogi Adityanath has announced financial assistance of ₹4 lakh each to the families of the deceased. As many as four deaths were reported from Banda, two from Fatehpur and one each from Balrampur, Chandauli, Bulandshahr, Raebareli, Amethi, Kaushambi, Sultanpur and Chitrakoot districts.

363.title: The anxiety is beyond comparison: Ranbir Kapoor on becoming a father
363.article_body: Discussing the arrival of his first child following his recent marriage to actress Alia Bhatt, actor Ranbir Kapoor said, "The nervousness and...anxiety for such a thing doesn't compare to anything." "It's beyond [comparison]," added Ranbir. Recently when asked to share two truths and a lie, Ranbir had mentioned having twins along with taking a long break from acting.

364.title: Ruturaj should make his ODI debut vs WI, open with Dhawan: Jaffer
364.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said Ruturaj Gaikwad should make his ODI debut against West Indies. "Ruturaj should open with Shikhar Dhawan. He scored four tons in five innings in the Vijay Hazare Trophy and deserves a look in. Also, left-right combo stays," tweeted Jaffer. The 25-year-old has played nine T20Is so far, scoring a total of 135 runs.

365.title: Uddhav not a face for 2024 Lok Sabha polls: Rebel Shiv Sena MP Shewale
365.article_body: Uddhav Thackeray was not a "winnable" face for the 2024 Lok Sabha elections and it was imperative for Shiv Sena to tie up with the BJP, said rebel Shiv Sena MP Rahul Shewale on Thursday. "I told (Sanjay Raut) that we respect Thackeray but we have to be realistic. He cannot be the face for Lok Sabha polls," Shewale added.

366.title: Don't relate to fragile entertainment of Johars, Chopras: Screwvala
366.article_body: Discussing the films he makes, producer Ronnie Screwvala said he likes to tell stories that can make a difference. Screwvala added he doesn't relate to the "fragile entertainment" of the Johars and the Chopras. However, he stated it doesn't mean their entertainment isn't good. "They pack in all the stars...the songs...people want that kind of entertainment too," he concluded.

367.title: 'Revadi' is called 'prasad' when distributed to public for free: Kejriwal
367.article_body: AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal responded to BJP's "revadi culture" remark and said, "When 'revadi' is distributed among public for free, then it's called 'prasad'." "But when [revadi] is given for free to your own friends, ministers, then it is 'paap' (sin)," he added. His statement comes after BJP said that "revadi culture" may push Gujarat towards Sri Lanka-like crisis.

368.title: Cyberabad Police arrest 35-yr-old man for cheating, marrying 13 women
368.article_body: The Cyberabad Police have arrested a 35-year-old man for allegedly cheating and marrying 13 women across Andhra Pradesh and Telangana in last four years. The accused, hailing from Andhra Pradesh's Guntur district, used to target rich women who were divorced and looking for alliances, reports said. After marrying them, the accused absconded with their money and valuables, reports added.

369.title: 21-yr-old engineering student found dead in hostel room in B'luru
369.article_body: A 21-year-old engineering student was found dead in her hostel room in Bengaluru's Kengeri area on Wednesday, police said. The deceased, identified as Shivani K, was a native of Bidar. The incident came to light when the warden went to check on Shivani after she missed her exam. Police have registered a case of unnatural death and are investigating.

370.title: Over 1.5 lakh people left Sri Lanka since Jan amid economic crisis
370.article_body: Over 1.5 lakh people have left Sri Lanka since January of this year to pursue job prospects abroad, Sri Lankan foreign employment bureau informed. The top destinations where Sri Lankan expatriates migrated to this year include Kuwait, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, South Korea and Japan, the bureau said. Sri Lanka is reeling under its worst economic crisis in over seven decades.

371.title: What are the salaries of Hollywood stars as Tom Cruise tops list with $100 million?
371.article_body: Tom Cruise has become Hollywood's highest earning actor, after he earned more than $100 million for 'Top Gun: Maverick', as per Variety. Will Smith came second with $35 million for his upcoming film 'Emancipation', followed by Leonardo DiCaprio and Brad Pitt, at $30 million each, for 'Killers of the Flower Moon' and an upcoming untitled Formula 1 drama, respectively.

372.title: World's most powerful telescope discovers oldest galaxy ever seen, pic surfaces
372.article_body: The world's most powerful telescope, the James Webb Space Telescope, has discovered the oldest galaxy ever seen. The galaxy is known as GLASS-z13 and it existed 13.5 billion years ago. The GLASS-z13 galaxy was spotted in the 'early release' data from the James Webb Space Telescope's main infrared imager, called NIRcam.

373.title: BJP leader shares Maha Cong chief's video with woman, he reacts
373.article_body: BJP leader Chitra Wagh tweeted a video purportedly showing Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole with a woman. "I'm not peeping into anyone's personal life. The video has already gone viral," she told reporters. Calling it a "character assassination" attempt by the BJP, Patole said he has asked his legal team to examine the video and take appropriate action against Wagh.

374.title: If Gandhi family is spotless, why is it anxious?: Anurag Thakur
374.article_body: As Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi appeared before ED, Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Thursday said that it’s the duty of probe agencies to investigate people involved in corruption. "If the Gandhi family is spotless, why is it anxious? If they have not indulged in corruption then why this ruckus," Thakur added.

375.title: Military believes it's not a good idea for Pelosi to visit Taiwan: Biden
375.article_body: US President Joe Biden said the military officials believe that it's "not a good idea" for US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi to visit Taiwan at this moment. Biden's comments came a day after China's Foreign Ministry said it would take "strong measures" if Pelosi visited Taiwan. The Financial Times had reported that Pelosi would visit the Chinese-claimed island next month.

376.title: Not even 10% nullahs cleaned: BJP on waterlogging in Mumbai
376.article_body: BJP MLA Yogesh Sagar on Wednesday alleged that the waterlogging in Mumbai following heavy rains is due to lack of nullah cleaning. "Despite spending crores of rupees...not even 10% of nullah cleaning has taken place this year before the monsoon," Sagar said. "Strict action should be taken against the contractors and I urge...BMC Commissioner to stop their payments," he added.

377.title: No need for female James Bond: 'No Time to Die' actress Ana De Armas
377.article_body: Actress Ana De Armas, who had featured in the James Bond film 'No Time to Die', has said that there is no need for female James Bond. "There shouldn't be any need to steal someone else's character...to take over," she stated. However, Ana added actresses in the upcoming James Bond films should be given a more substantial part and recognition.

378.title: ED questions Sonia Gandhi for 2 hours, ends session at her request
378.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi left the Enforcement Directorate (ED) office in Delhi after being questioned for nearly two hours in the National Herald case. The agency ended the question session at her request as she is recovering from COVID-19, officials said. Her questioning was postponed earlier as she was hospitalised after testing positive for the infection.

379.title: Series against India opportunity to beat the best cricketers in world: Powell
379.article_body: West Indies batter Rovman Powell has said the series against India is an opportunity to defeat the "most favoured and fancy team" in cricket. "It provides an opportunity...to stake a claim and make a name against the best cricketers of the world," he added. Powell further said that he wants to test himself against Yuzvendra Chahal in the series.

380.title: ED should've questioned Sonia Gandhi at her residence: Yashwant Sinha
380.article_body: Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha said Enforcement Directorate (ED) should've gone to Congress leader Sonia Gandhi's residence to question her in the National Herald case. He also accused ED of humiliating political leaders. "We condemn this and resolve to continue and intensify our collective fight against...policies of Modi Sarkar," a joint statement by Opposition parties read.

381.title: MP man attacked with sharp weapons for supporting Nupur Sharma
381.article_body: A man was injured after he was attacked by a group of people armed with sharp-edged weapons, in Madhya Pradesh, for allegedly expressing support for suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma on Wednesday, officials said. Following a complaint, the police filed a case against 13 people for the attack on the man and arrested two of the accused, the police said.

382.title: Delhi court adjourns Sharjeel Imam's interim bail hearing till July 23
382.article_body: A Delhi court on Wednesday adjourned the interim bail hearing of activist and former JNU scholar Sharjeel Imam till July 23. "Imam did not make any conscious call for violence or incitement to violent activities," his advocate told the court. Imam was allegedly assaulted and called a "terrorist and anti-national" during a security check inside Tihar jail on June 30.

383.title: Sri Lanka made dumb bets on Chinese investments, says CIA chief
383.article_body: CIA chief Bill Burns has said that Sri Lanka's "dumb bets" on Chinese investment are one of the factors for the country's economic crisis. "The Chinese have a lot of weight to throw around and they can make a very appealing case for their investments," Burns claimed. Sri Lanka's example should serve as a warning to other nations, Burns added.

384.title: Sadhu sets himself on fire to protest against illegal mining in Raj
384.article_body: A sadhu set himself on fire on Wednesday to protest against illegal stone mining in Bharatpur, Rajasthan. The sadhu, Vijay Das, was rescued by policemen and was rushed to a hospital. Earlier, another sadhu scaled a mobile tower to protest. Sadhus are protesting against mining in hills of Adi Badri and Kankachal, which are revered by devotees of Lord Krishna.

385.title: Over 500 disabled people cheated via scam in Pune; police seize ₹1 cr
385.article_body: Pune Police have busted a fraudulent investment scheme that cheated 570 people with hearing and speech impairments and have so far seized ₹1 crore from the accused. The six accused, all of whom have been arrested, are also hearing and speech impaired. The accused had reportedly promised the investors of double returns on their money within two months.

386.title: I am not a friend of Rajapaksas: Sri Lanka's new Prez Wickremesinghe
386.article_body: Sri Lanka's new President Ranil Wickremesinghe has said that he's "not a friend of the Rajapaksas" but "a friend of the people". Wickremesinghe added he would give people the change they want. In recent months, the three brothers from the Rajapaksa family, Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa, PM Mahinda Rajapaksa and President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, were forced to resign amid mass protests.

387.title: Droupadi Murmu leading with 540 votes in Presidential poll after 1st round of counting
387.article_body: NDA's Droupadi Murmu is leading with 540 votes in Presidential election after the 1st round of counting, PC Mody, Secretary General, Rajya Sabha, said. He added that Opposition's Yashwant Sinha has secured 208 votes with a value of 1,45,600. Results of the Presidential election are expected around 4 pm.

388.title: Somebody has to be looking to score a hundred vs India: WI coach Simmons
388.article_body: West Indies coach Phil Simmons has said their priority is to bat out the entire 50 overs in the ODIs against India. "Somebody has to be looking to score a hundred and hold the team together," stated Simmons. "India are a stronger bowling team but we expect a better batting performance," he added. The first ODI will be played tomorrow.

389.title: Rupee's depreciation against US$ lower than other key currencies: CEA
389.article_body: Indian Rupee's depreciation against the US$ has been lower than that of other major global currencies, said Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran. "You look at the Japanese Yen and the British Pound. They all have depreciated much more against the US$," Nageswaran said. "RBI is managing the monetary policy and has announced liberalised rules to attract inflows," he added.

390.title: Maharashtra govt lifts stay on constructing Aarey car shed
390.article_body: The Maharashtra government has lifted the stay on constructing a car shed in Mumbai's Aarey Milk Colony for Metro 3. Former Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray had put the stay on assuming office in November 2019. Several environmental groups had opposed the decision to set up the car shed in the wooded Aarey area.

391.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann admitted to hospital after drinking polluted water: Report
391.article_body: Days after he drank a glassful of water directly from Kali Bein, a holy rivulet in Sultanpur Lodhi, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann was reportedly admitted to Delhi's Apollo Hospital with stomach ache on Tuesday. A video shows him drinking the water, which contains sewage waste. On Sunday, he visited Sultanpur Lodhi to mark 22nd anniversary of cleaning of Kali Bein.

392.title: Other sides will dance if Suryakumar isn't in lineup for WI ODIs: Styris
392.article_body: Ex-New Zealand all-rounder Scott Styris said every other team around the world will dance if batter Suryakumar Yadav is not included in India's lineup for the ODIs against West Indies. "He's got...match-winning potential...No pressure situations get to him," added Styris. Suryakumar recently scored 117 off 55 balls in the third T20I against England. He had a strike rate of 212.72.

393.title: I've seen sister Khushi work hard & tirelessly for 'The Archies': Janhvi
393.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor opened up about her sister Khushi Kapoor's debut film 'The Archies'.  "I've seen my sister work tirelessly...work really hard and she's auditioning for this role," she stated. Janhvi added, "She wanted this so badly, I'm just so happy for her and I hope it goes well." The film also features Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana Khan.

394.title: Goa will host the 37th National Games in 2023: Sports Minister
394.article_body: Sports Minister Govind Gaude informed that Goa will host the 37th National Games in 2023. "I am very much happy to announce that...the government of Goa has received an email from Indian Olympics Association in consultation with the Union Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports that Goa will be the host city for organising 37th National Games,” Gaude said.

395.title: BCCI spends ₹3.5 crore on Team India's chartered flight to West Indies from UK: Reports
395.article_body: The BCCI spent around ₹3.5 crore on booking a chartered flight for India to reach West Indies from United Kingdom, reports said. "The reason a chartered flight was booked for the team was not COVID-19. It's difficult to book so many tickets in a commercial flight," a BCCI source said. "It was a logical option to take," the source added.

396.title: GST imposed on puffed rice, curd, what will people eat?: Mamata in Kolkata
396.article_body: Addressing a rally on TMC's Martyrs' Day in West Bengal's Kolkata, CM Mamata Banerjee criticised BJP for the current rise in GST rates and said, "Now that GST has been imposed on puffed rice as well, so will the people of BJP not eat that now." "GST is levied on sweets, lassi, and curd. What will people eat?" she added.

397.title: So hard-hitting & engaging: Karan Johar on Alia Bhatt's 'Darlings'
397.article_body: Taking to Instagram, Karan Johar praised Alia Bhatt's upcoming film 'Darlings'. "So fun! So hard-hitting and so engaging! All at once...Congratulations my baby girl Alia, what a brave decision to begin your producer journey with," he captioned the post. Karan praised Shah Rukh Khan and his wife Gauri Khan for giving a "green light" to the project.

398.title: Italian Prime Minister Mario Draghi resigns
398.article_body: Italian Prime Minister Mario Draghi has handed in his resignation to President Sergio Mattarella, who asked him to remain in office in a caretaker capacity. The President's office did not say whether Mattarella would dissolve parliament or call early elections. Draghi's resignation came after three coalition parties withdrew their support for his government.

399.title: ED should have gone to Sonia Gandhi's house for investigation: Raj CM Gehlot
399.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot has criticised the Enforcement Directorate for asking Congress' interim President Sonia Gandhi to appear in its Delhi office for questioning in connection with the National Herald case. "The kind of personality and aura she has and since she is more than 70 years old, ED should have gone to her house for investigation," Gehlot said.

400.title: Goa tourism body demands rollback of GST hike on small, medium hotels
400.article_body: The Travel and Tourism Association of Goa (TTAG) demanded a rollback on hike in GST rate for small and medium hotels, saying it will make them uncompetitive and lead to increase in compliance costs. After the implementation of the new GST rates, hotels with tariffs below ₹1,000 per night will now have to pay 12% GST which was 0% earlier.

401.title: I'm only actor to do 4-5 sex comedies, I'm not ashamed: Riteish Deshmukh
401.article_body: Actor Riteish Deshmukh, who has featured in films like 'Masti', 'Grand Masti', 'Kyaa Kool Hai Hum', has said he is the "only actor" to do "four to five sex comedies". "I'm not ashamed of that...I never thought, what would my son think in the future," he added. He stated he did those films when his father was Maharashtra's Chief Minister.
